Screen Sharing Issues with Instructor Application - Mac
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

If you use a Mac and cannot share your screen with the class, you need to allow Engageli to screen record and screen share in the system preferences. You will still be able to "share," but you'll notice that nothing will appear in your screen share preview, and learners will not be able to see your screen share.

 

Note: You’ll know this applies to you if when you click “SHARE” most of the items are grayed out or blank. 

 

Using the Instructor Application

Sharing Settings

 

Using the Instructor Application

 1. To grant permission to share your screen on a Mac computer, click on the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

 

2. Select "System Preferences" from the drop-down menu.

 

3. Select "Security & Privacy" from the pop-up window.

 

4. Under the Privacy tab, scroll down and select "Screen Recording." Ensure that the Engageli icon is checked.

 

5. You will likely be prompted to restart the application for this change to take effect. If you need to do this during class, learners will not be impacted. They will be able to stay logged into the class until you return. 

 

 

Sharing Settings

1. To check your “Sharing” settings, click on the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select “System Preferences” from the drop-down menu.

3. Click “Sharing” from the pop-up window.

 


4. Check the box for “Screen Sharing” if it is not already selected. 

Note: If the box for “Remote Management” is checked, you might not be able to share your entire screen on Engageli, and will need to contact an Administrator at your institution. However, you will be able to share browser tabs.

 

You should now be able to share your screen with the class, but if you are still having trouble you should answer the following questions:

 

1. What device are you using? We currently do not support mobile or tablet devices. If a user is on one of these, instruct them to join via laptop, computer, or Chromebook.

2. Do you have 3rd party anti-virus software that is blocking screen sharing? Check your 3rd party anti-virus software.

3. Did your permissions get reset? Sometimes permissions are reset without any notification, so recheck your settings to make sure Engageli has permission to share and record your screen.

If none of this works, reach out to our Support team.

You can also use the PDF Live share to share a presentation directly in Engageli without sharing your screen.

How to optimize for low bandwidth or CPU - Learners
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

If you join an Engageli classroom using an older computer or if you have low internet bandwidth, you can adjust your settings to optimize your learning experience.

 

1. Check your internet connection 

Other computers/devices using the same network can cause the network to slow down, which can result in audio and video issues. 

2. Switch to Low bandwidth mode

Click the More Actions (three dots) menu at the bottom of your screen, and then click Low bandwidth mode. This mode will save bandwidth by automatically turning off the video feeds of other learners at your table and when learners raise their hands at the podium. Video feeds in the gallery will still be visible in a merged view. The merged gallery view will save bandwidth by merging the gallery into one video feed for all learners instead of having individual video feeds for each learner.

3. Turn off your video

Turning off your video feed is an easy way to lower your computer’s CPU usage and improve network traffic. If needed, discuss with your instructor beforehand, but start your video only when you have to or leave it off for the duration of your class session.

4. Mute your audio

Your audio doesn’t use as much bandwidth as your video, but you can reduce your bandwidth by muting your audio when you’re not speaking. 

5. Close other applications

To free up more network resources, close other applications and programs you do not need during your Engageli session. 

 

For optimal performance with Engageli, we recommend keeping your operating system and browsers up to date. You may have trouble using certain features on Engageli if you are joining your virtual classroom in parallel with CPU- intensive applications such as cloud computing and streaming services.

If you’re teaching on Engageli using the Google Chrome browser and can only share a Chrome table and not a window or the entire screen, or if you can’t share your screen at all, follow these steps to resolve the issue.

 

Instructions

1. Go to the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select System Settings.

3. Select Privacy & Security.

4. Find the Screen Recording option under the Privacy tab of this menu.

5. Flip the switch next to Google Chrome to enable access.

5. If you do not see Google Chrome in the screen recording section, click the plus icon.


8. Select Google Chrome from your applications folder, and then click Open.

9. Quit and relaunch the browser. 

Note: You must restart Google Chrome for these changes to take.

 

This is only for Google Chrome and not for the Engageli application. Click here for instructions to resolve screen sharing issues using the Engageli instructor application on a Mac. 

If screen sharing issues persist, please see steps below. 

Check Sharing Settings

Instructions

1. To check your Sharing settings, go to the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select System Settings from the drop-down menu.

3. Search for and select Screen Sharing.

4. Check the box for Screen Sharing if it is not already checked. 

Note: If the box for Remote Management is checked, you might not be able to share your entire screen on Engageli, and will need to contact an Administrator at your institution. However, you will be able to share browser tabs.

You should now be able to share your screen with the class, but if you are still having trouble you should answer the following questions: 

What device are you using? We currently do not support mobile or tablet devices. If a user is on one of these, instruct them to join via laptop, computer, or Chromebook.
What browser are you using? We currently do not recommend Safari or Firefox browsers. If a user is on one of these, invite them to join Engageli via Chrome, Edge, or a browser on Chromium (Opera, Vivaldi, Brave).
Have you tried refreshing the browser? If not, instruct the user to refresh the browser (log out and log back in). Simply taking this action can sometimes solve your problem. 
Do you have an extension running that is blocking screen sharing? Check your extensions or 3rd party anti-virus software.
Did your permissions get reset? Sometimes permissions are reset without any notification, so recheck your settings to make sure Engageli has permission to share and record your screen.

If none of this works, reach out to our Support team.

You can also use the PDF Live Share to share a presentation directly in Engageli without sharing your screen.

How to Record and Share Class Recordings
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

 It's easy to record and share class recordings within Engageli so you and your learners can revisit class discussions, content, and material as needed!

Recording Settings (Pre-Class)

1. To access recording settings, go to the Admin Portal. 

2. Click Classes [Class Management in Engageli 3.0] on the left to expand the menu. 

3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class. 

4. Click Details.

5. Select the Configuration tab.

6. Check Record learners' videos if you want to include in the class recordings the video feeds of learners who raise their hands to join the podium. If this option is unchecked, only the learners' audio will be captured in the recording.  

7. Check Auto start recording if you want the recording to automatically start after you log in and launch the classroom. This is helpful in case you forget to start the class recording.

Note: Settings will persist between class sessions. This means the setting(s) you selected most recently will be the default for future classes unless you change it. 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors and admins have options to record the Class Gallery and make the recording private by default.

 

Recording During Class 

1. Once the class has started, click the green dot (Record Lecture) to begin recording. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button at the bottom of the screen. 

2. While recording, you can pause, stop, or continue the recording at any time.  

3. If you want to pause the recording, click the red dot (Stop Recording). Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button to pause. 

4. If/when you want to resume the recording, click the green dot (Record Lecture) again. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button again to resume.

5. The recording will stop when class ends.

After class, a link to the recording will be emailed to the email address that you used to sign into Engageli. Each instructor listed on the roster will receive the email. The recording link is sent from a "do not reply" address, so if you don’t see it within five minutes to one hour, please check your Spam folder. 

Click here to learn which components are included in the class recording and ways you can optimize the recording for asynchronous learning in the Playback Room.

Recording Indicator 

When the class is being recorded, a red dot will appear in the top right corner of the instructor's video. Learners and instructors on the browser will see the following:

 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, in addition to the red dot, all users will see and hear a notification whenever the recording starts or is paused.

Recordings After Class

After class, you can access recordings in the Admin Portal. 

1. Under your class, go to Recordings and you will see a list of all recordings.

2. You can easily change the name of the recordings by clicking the titles listed under Name. 

3. If needed, you can delete a recording by selecting the checkbox to the left of the name, and then clicking the Delete icon in the upper right corner of the screen.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the Recordings List in the Admin Portal has been enhanced to provide more options for instructors including making recordings private and uploading 3rd party transcripts.

Playback Rooms 

Learners can easily review class recordings in the Playback Room. Playback Rooms are open classrooms where learners can, independently or in a group of up to 10, access class content and engage with the material. Learners can review class recordings, participate in polls, ask and answer questions in the Q&A, take notes, and - if in a group - chat, talk, and learn together.

Using the same link for logging into the live class, learners select "Playback room" at the top of the screen. Click here to learn more.

Refresh the page to enable the changes.

Click on the microphone/camera icon in the right side of the URL bar, there should be a red X over it to indicate that permission is denied. 
Click Open Settings
On the left side of the settings you can select Camera, Screen Recording (screen sharing), or Microphone. Check the box next to your browser for each of these options, and then restart your browser for the changes to be applied.

Screen Sharing Issues with Google Chrome - Mac
2 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

If you’re teaching on Engageli using the Google Chrome browser and can only share a Chrome table and not a window or the entire screen, or if you can’t share your screen at all, follow these steps to resolve the issue.

 

Instructions

1. Go to the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select System Settings.

3. Select Privacy & Security.

4. Find the Screen Recording option under the Privacy tab of this menu.

5. Flip the switch next to Google Chrome to enable access.

5. If you do not see Google Chrome in the screen recording section, click the plus icon.


8. Select Google Chrome from your applications folder, and then click Open.

9. Quit and relaunch the browser. 

Note: You must restart Google Chrome for these changes to take.

 

This is only for Google Chrome and not for the Engageli application. Click here for instructions to resolve screen sharing issues using the Engageli instructor application on a Mac. 

If screen sharing issues persist, please see steps below. 

Check Sharing Settings

Instructions

1. To check your Sharing settings, go to the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select System Settings from the drop-down menu.

3. Search for and select Screen Sharing.

4. Check the box for Screen Sharing if it is not already checked. 

Note: If the box for Remote Management is checked, you might not be able to share your entire screen on Engageli, and will need to contact an Administrator at your institution. However, you will be able to share browser tabs.

You should now be able to share your screen with the class, but if you are still having trouble you should answer the following questions: 

What device are you using? We currently do not support mobile or tablet devices. If a user is on one of these, instruct them to join via laptop, computer, or Chromebook.
What browser are you using? We currently do not recommend Safari or Firefox browsers. If a user is on one of these, invite them to join Engageli via Chrome, Edge, or a browser on Chromium (Opera, Vivaldi, Brave).
Have you tried refreshing the browser? If not, instruct the user to refresh the browser (log out and log back in). Simply taking this action can sometimes solve your problem. 
Do you have an extension running that is blocking screen sharing? Check your extensions or 3rd party anti-virus software.
Did your permissions get reset? Sometimes permissions are reset without any notification, so recheck your settings to make sure Engageli has permission to share and record your screen.

If none of this works, reach out to our Support team.

You can also use the PDF Live Share to share a presentation directly in Engageli without sharing your screen.

When a classroom is Locked, it is not in session and is closed. Learners cannot enter a locked classroom without having an instructor logged in.

When a classroom is Unlocked, learners can enter without having an instructor logged in.

Engageli classrooms are unlocked by default. 

To unlock a classroom:

Go to the Admin Portal.

Click Classes (Class Management in v3.0) on the left to expand the menu.

Select your class or use the search field to find your class.

Click the class name.

Click Unlock Class in the upper right corner. 

When an Engageli class is not in session, it is considered “locked” or closed. This means that you can edit your roster, create table presets, name tables, add video clips to be shared, and upload documents to be distributed during class.

When an Engageli class is in session, it is considered “unlocked.” You can still access the class settings through the Portal but you will have some limitations as to what changes you can make.

 

 

You need to “lock” or end the class in order to:

Delete or edit users from the roster. 
Change a learner’s gallery position or group table.
Change table names.
Add tables.
Remove tables
Add or remove table presets
Add or edit materials
Edit sub-rooms
Enable guest links.

You can choose to lock the class in order to make any of the above changes, but doing so will end the class and remove the learners from the classroom. 

Note: When the class is “unlocked” or in session, you can still add people to the roster, but you can’t delete them or edit their roles (instructor, TA, student).

Similar to creating random table arrangements, instructors can split learners into table groups based on similar or dissimilar poll responses. You can now easily skip or set aside tables during these table arrangements.

 

The number of tables to skip corresponds to the first nine tables in the classroom, left to right. If you choose to skip 1 table, no learners will be assigned to Table 1. If you choose to skip 2 tables, no learners will be assigned to Table 1 or Table 2. All users (learners, TAs, and instructors) can take part in polls, but TAs won’t be re-arranged when you use the “Split Learners by Poll Results” feature. If they are placed at a skipped table, they will remain at the table, but no other learners will be assigned to that table.

Instructions

Run the poll in your shared presentation or PDF. (Note: Splitting learners based on poll results is applicable only for single-answer polls.)
Click Start Poll Split.
Select whether you want to split learners by Diverse or Common responses.
Use the slider to the maximum number of learners you want at each table. (TAs won’t be moved to a different table.)
Use the slider to choose the number of learners per table.
If you want to reserve [skip in Engageli 3.0] or set aside certain tables, use the slider to select up to the first 3 tables.
Click Split [Confirm in Engageli 3.0].

When to use:
When you have support individuals, such as teaching assistants, administrative staff, or mentors who will not take part in table activities based on poll results
When you have a dedicated support table, with individuals who you’d like to place at that table to assist learners 
When you have someone observing your teaching and you’d like to place them at a set table so you can join and discuss their observations while learners work in their table groups
When you have guests who you would like to place at one table so you can join the table and discuss the poll results or other content while learners work in their table groups
When you have guests who you would like to place at one table so you can easily add them to a panel or ask them to join the podium

How to Access Engageli’s Raise Hand Analytics

Go to the Admin Portal.

Raise Hand Analytics Overview

Raise Hand Analytics displays the total number of raised hands per class (chart view) and per individual learner or TA (list view). You can filter to include staff and guests in the data.

Raise Hand - Participant clicks the hand raise button on-screen and then moves to the podium
Podium Time - Amount of time the users who raised their hands spend on the podium, not including speaking time
Raise Hand Count - Total number of individual hand raises during a specific class session
Date/Time - Month, day, and start time of the scheduled class session
Time in Class - Class duration broken down into 5-minute intervals

 

  Chart View 

This view displays a high level overview of Raise Hand analytics.

Click an individual bar on the chart to drill down to view the Raise Hand count for the selected class.

List View

The List View dives deeper into details for each participant and shows the number of hands raised as well as time spent on the podium for each registered participant. 

Scheduled class date and time [Month, Day - Start Time]
Name
Email address - Email address listed on the roster
Raise Hand - Number of raised hands for the participant
Podium Time - Total amount of podium time for the participant, not including speaking time

Using Your Created Polls
18 days ago Updated

Engageli polls are great for icebreaker activities, checking concept understanding, breakout discussions, or collaboration with tables. 

 

Creating a Poll or Quiz

Running a Poll or Quiz in Class

Sharing Poll or Quiz Results

Locking the Poll or Quiz

Ending a Poll or Quiz

Viewing Learner Poll Response in the Class Gallery 

 

Running a Poll or Quiz in Class

1. To start a quiz or poll, first make sure that you are in your Engageli classroom.

2. Share your screen with the document containing the quiz or poll you want to run.

3. Click the Scan button [Activate Tag (QR Code) in Engageli 3.0] button to start the poll or quiz. 

Engageli 3.1

Engageli 3.0

 





Sharing Poll or Quiz Results

1. You can share the results with your class by using the Share Results toggle. This allows learners to see the total number of selections for each answer choice. You can also see the number of learners who answered and did not answer the poll question. This is will not appear to learners when you share the results.


Pro Tip! Use poll responses to group learners for discussion. You can ask learners to move to a specific table based on their answer or you can randomly assign tables and have them discuss which answer they chose and why.  

Share the Correct Answer to a Poll or Quiz 

If your poll or quiz has a correct answer that you would like to share with the learners, you can click the specific option(s) in your screen share. The correct answer(s) will display a check mark when you share the results of the poll or quiz.

 

Locking the Poll or Quiz

1. Selecting Lock Answers will prevent learners from submitting additional responses or changing responses.

Pro Tip! Locking can be useful for conducting timed polls and quizzes as well as preventing learners from changing their responses while sharing results with the class.

 

Ending the Poll or Quiz

1. To stop the poll or quiz, click the Scan button [Activate Tag in Engageli 3.0] button again or click the Stop Poll button in the top right corner of the screen. 

Viewing Learner Poll Response in the Class Gallery

While you're running the poll or quiz, you can view the learners' individual final poll responses displayed on their video feeds in the Class Gallery. Once you stop the poll or move to the next screen in your presentation, the green or gray dot engagement marker will return to the learners' video feeds. Under My View, change your view to the Class Gallery to see the responses.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors can see learner responses to text poll questions on their video feeds in the Class Gallery.

Click here to learn how to split learners into tables based on poll results.

Adding a quiz or a poll to your presentation can help you learn more about your learners and check their understanding of the material.

 

1. Choose if this is a single choice, multiple choice, or text input question.

Single choice: There are multiple options to choose from, but only one answer can be selected.

Multiple choice: There are multiple options to choose from, and you can select as many answers as you want.

Text input: You can type a short response (up to 40 characters) and the answers will form a word cloud on the screen.

2. Set up your slide or document with your question, leaving room for the tags (QR codes).

 

3. Click and drag the tags from step 1 into your slide or document depending on the response type you want for your poll.

Note: The same tag must be used for each answer choice and must be at least 75x75 px in size.

 

You can create customized tags for polls and quizzes in the Action Tags Lab.

1. Go to the Action Tags Lab in the Admin portal.
2. Select Polls & Quizzes.
3. Select a poll type from the 3 options:

Single choice
Multiple choice
Text input (word cloud)

4. Name your tag with the label or response option that learners will see in the poll.
5. Copy the poll tag to paste into a document or slide.
6. Or, download a copy of the poll tag.

How to Create Assigned Seats and Table Presets
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Open seating is the default, but sometimes it can be helpful to assign seats for certain times or specific activities during the session.

You can save multiple presets to use at different times during the class (e.g. start of class, activity time, quiz time, etc.). This allows you to easily ‘move’ learners into different pre-assigned groups without having to use class time to create them.

Instructions

Go to the Admin Portal.
Click Class Management from the menu on the Left.
Select your class from the list of Active Classes or use the search field to find your class.

Click the class name.
Select Tables & Presets from the menu on the left.
Click the Tables tab to add custom names for each table, if desired.                     
Click the Presets tab to create or upload a preset. 
Click View a sample/CSV template here to open the template as a Google Document.  
Choose File > Make a copy. You can name this copy whatever you like.
Add each learner’s email and the table you want them added to upon joining. In this example, we have placed three students in each project group. Upon login, they will automatically be placed at Project Group 1 table and Project Group 2 table. Please note: The tables in your .cvs file must match the names of the tables you created in step 6. If you did not rename tables, use the default table names: Table 1, Table 2, Table 3, etc. 
When finished, go to File > Download > Comma-separated values (.csv, current sheet) to save the file to your computer.
Click Upload Preset.
Name the preset and add a description if helpful (ex: Group Activity - Use this preset when you start group activity).                                                                
Upload the preset by clicking Files, and then Add.                         
Once presets have been uploaded, you will see a learner’s assigned location for each preset saved next to their name in the Roster tab in the portal. 

Note: Without presets, you can still assign learners to randomly-combined groups of select sizes (1-10 learners) at any time. Click here for instructions.

If you’re teaching on Engageli using the Google Chrome browser and can only share a Chrome table and not a window or the entire screen, or if you can’t share your screen at all, follow these steps to resolve the issue.

 

Instructions

1. Go to the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select System Settings.

3. Select Privacy & Security.

4. Find the Screen Recording option under the Privacy tab of this menu.

5. Flip the switch next to Google Chrome to enable access.

5. If you do not see Google Chrome in the screen recording section, click the plus icon.


8. Select Google Chrome from your applications folder, and then click Open.

9. Quit and relaunch the browser. 

Note: You must restart Google Chrome for these changes to take.

 

This is only for Google Chrome and not for the Engageli application. Click here for instructions to resolve screen sharing issues using the Engageli instructor application on a Mac. 

If screen sharing issues persist, please see steps below. 

Check Sharing Settings

Instructions

1. To check your Sharing settings, go to the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select System Settings from the drop-down menu.

3. Search for and select Screen Sharing.

4. Check the box for Screen Sharing if it is not already checked. 

Note: If the box for Remote Management is checked, you might not be able to share your entire screen on Engageli, and will need to contact an Administrator at your institution. However, you will be able to share browser tabs.

You should now be able to share your screen with the class, but if you are still having trouble you should answer the following questions: 

What device are you using? We currently do not support mobile or tablet devices. If a user is on one of these, instruct them to join via laptop, computer, or Chromebook.
What browser are you using? We currently do not recommend Safari or Firefox browsers. If a user is on one of these, invite them to join Engageli via Chrome, Edge, or a browser on Chromium (Opera, Vivaldi, Brave).
Have you tried refreshing the browser? If not, instruct the user to refresh the browser (log out and log back in). Simply taking this action can sometimes solve your problem. 
Do you have an extension running that is blocking screen sharing? Check your extensions or 3rd party anti-virus software.
Did your permissions get reset? Sometimes permissions are reset without any notification, so recheck your settings to make sure Engageli has permission to share and record your screen.

If none of this works, reach out to our Support team.

You can also use the PDF Live Share to share a presentation directly in Engageli without sharing your screen.

3 months ago Updated

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the learner view in the audio modes has changed. Click to understand more about Room Mode and Table Mode and how to effectively use Engageli's audio modes to foster active learning and collaboration. 

Engageli now has two main audio modes, Room Mode and Table Mode.

Room Mode:

This is the default when you enter your Engageli classroom. This means that as the instructor you will hear the audio feeds from all learners, and they will hear each other, regardless of where they are seated.

When to use: the beginning of class, or entire classroom discussions

 

Table Mode:

When you enable Table Mode, learners will hear only their table mates and you will only hear learners who raise their hands. 

When to use: small group discussions, projects, and other table activities

 

You can easily toggle between the two modes from the bottom right corner of the screen.

  

If you or a co-instructor join a table, Engageli automatically switches to Table Mode. When at a table, you will only hear the learners at that table (and any learners at other tables that raise their hands).  While an instructor is at a table, no instructor will be able to change the mode to Room Mode. 

For learners, the tablemates panel will automatically close when switching the audio mode to Room mode from the Table audio mode so learners direct their attention back to the class.

If you would like to hear all the learners concurrently while at the podium in Table Mode, click on the three dots and choose ‘Hear tables while on podium in table mode’. 

 

 

You can hover over the Table Mode and Room Mode buttons to see who you can hear and who can hear you. 





Note: All audio will be recorded in Room Mode and only those on podium (learners with hands raised or instructor(s)) will be recorded in Table Mode.

 

Click to learn how to add a tag to your presentation for a reminder to switch between Room Mode and Table Mode.

If your browser’s Microphone/Camera permissions are not properly set, you will be prompted to “Allow” access on the classroom login screen. Use these steps to ensure that Edge or Google Chrome and Windows have the correct permissions.

Make sure you’re using Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome.

If you’re still seeing that your camera and microphone are not working after following these steps then you’ll also need to adjust the permissions in your Windows settings.
Open Windows Settings.
Click Privacy & Security.
Click Camera.
Flip the switch to enable “Let desktop apps access your camera”.
Go back to Privacy & Security.
Click Microphone.
Flip the switch to enable “Let desktop apps access your microphone”.
Refresh the Engageli classroom.
If you see a red icon on the right side of the URL bar, click it and ensure you’re allowing access to your microphone and camera.

How to Create a Poll or Quiz
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Adding a quiz or a poll to your presentation can help you learn more about your learners and check their understanding of the material.

 

1. Choose if this is a single choice, multiple choice, or text input question.

Single choice: There are multiple options to choose from, but only one answer can be selected.

Multiple choice: There are multiple options to choose from, and you can select as many answers as you want.

Text input: You can type a short response (up to 40 characters) and the answers will form a word cloud on the screen.

2. Set up your slide or document with your question, leaving room for the tags (QR codes).

 

3. Click and drag the tags from step 1 into your slide or document depending on the response type you want for your poll.

Note: The same tag must be used for each answer choice and must be at least 75x75 px in size.

 

You can create customized tags for polls and quizzes in the Action Tags Lab.

1. Go to the Action Tags Lab in the Admin portal.
2. Select Polls & Quizzes.
3. Select a poll type from the 3 options:

Single choice
Multiple choice
Text input (word cloud)

4. Name your tag with the label or response option that learners will see in the poll.
5. Copy the poll tag to paste into a document or slide.
6. Or, download a copy of the poll tag.

Click here to learn how to use your created polls.

To share your screen while teaching on Engageli via Chrome, Edge, or Brave, follow these steps:

2. Click the Present button in the middle of your instructor controls at the bottom of the screen.

6. Your view will switch to what you are sharing. 

7. In Engageli, your view will default to the Class Gallery. You can see your screen share in the green Screen Sharing with Class window, which you can collapse. 

8. If you want to annotate the screen share, you can click the Annotate Screen button in the Screen Sharing with Class window, or select the Class Share tab at the top and click Annotate Screen.

9. To stop sharing, choose one of 4 options:

Click the Stop sharing button at the top of the screen if you're sharing a browser tab.
Click the Stop Class Share button in the middle of the screen on the Class Share tab. 
Click the Stop Class Share button in the middle of the My Screen Preview window.

How to Track Learner Engagement During Class
1 month ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

There are many ways to track engagement in Engageli. These markers can help you keep a pulse on how the class is engaging with and learning the content so you can adjust as needed.

 

Individual Engagement Markers

1. Thumbs up/thumbs down

You can ask learners to use the reactions to give you a thumbs up or down. Everyone will see the thumbs appear instantly on the screen, but only instructors and TAs will see individual thumbs up/thumbs down on the learners' video feeds in the Class Gallery.

Thumbs up or down can be used to get quick feedback, check understanding, or check if learners are paying attention. Some example questions to use with thumbs are:

"Do you understand the material we just covered?"
"Give me a thumbs up if you can see my screen."

Pro Tip! Use thumbs up or down to check engagement for learners with their cameras off. When coming back after a break, if many learners turned off their cameras, ask for a thumbs up if learners are back and then look at the class gallery to see how many thumbs up there are.

There are additional reactions and sounds for learners and instructors. Click here to learn more. 

2. Green Dot Marker

Each learner has an engagement marker in the bottom right corner of their video feed in the Class Gallery.

The green dot marker represents when a learner is "active," meaning that they have recently interacted in the classroom in some way. The green dot resets to the maximum size (5) each time a learner does one of the following:

Writes a question or answer in Q&A
Responds to a poll question
Raises hand
Lowers hand
Shares screen with their table
Shares screen with their class
Uses thumbs up/down
Uses other emojis reactions
Sends a chat message (private chats are not included)
Initiates audio activity (speaking, unmuting microphone)

Note: The green marker decays and appears smaller after some time. The decay is linear, from maximum (5) to minimum (0) over three minutes. Hovering over the indicator in a learner’s video feed shows an engagement value out of 5 (Engagement - 5/5). Any form of activity listed above will turn the marker green.

The gray dot marker replaces the green markers when a learner who was previously active has not recently interacted in the classroom. In general, a green marker will turn gray after three minutes. The gray marker corresponds to an Engagement rating of 0/5.

No marker simply means the learner has not interacted in the classroom at any point.

The perforated (dotted) marker indicates that a learner who was seated at a table has left the class. They are still represented in the class by what's called a reservation, as explained in this article.

You can also see the green dot marker next to the learner's name in the List view in the Tables tab.

 

Table Engagement

In addition to the learner’s video feed and the Lists view, the individual engagement markers trigger an engagement indication at the table level, which you can see in the Tables tab at the top of the screen.

Similar to the green dot marker, the green table ring decays and fades away after some time due to inactivity. The decay is linear, from maximum (5) to minimum (0) over three minutes.

These notes provide information about Engageli 3.0, including new and enhanced features, improvements, and resolved issues.

Engageli 3.0 takes the best of Engageli to a new level with a focus on ease-of-use. Based on feedback from partners, we've redesigned the Engageli classroom to better support teaching and active learning and provide a flexible learning environment for all participants. In addition to a variety of new features, Engageli’s team has enhanced the overall teaching and learning experience in many ways. 

New Features

Accessibility

Deaf and hard-of-hearing users can now learn with a dedicated sign language interpreter. Users can overlay the interpreter’s video over their classroom windows and customize the size and placement of the video at any time. 

Asynchronous Experience

Instructors can now customize the asynchronous experience. They can upload external videos to be viewed in an Engageli Playback Room, or upload PDFs for learners to access. They can also edit and trim class recordings to share the best version of the class with learners. 

Chat, Notes, Q&A

The new and improved chat allows users to filter and search for chat messages for better ease of use. Browser users can take and annotate screenshots in the chat and reply and add reactions (thumbs, hearts, etc.) to messages.

In-class Teaching Tools

The Distributed Docs feature has been enhanced to include Google Sheets and Slides and Microsoft 365 Word, Excel, and Powerpoint files. Instructors can share a file for class-wide collaboration as well as add and edit shared files during the class session, instead of preloading in the Admin Portal. 
New emojis and sounds have been added as reactions to enable users to give clear and immediate feedback. Instructors can customize the settings for the reactions.

Admin Portal

The Admin Portal has been updated with new classroom filters and search capabilities, automatically enabled classroom guest links, and a calendar invitation option that makes setting up classes easier. Instructors and admins can now filter the Chat, Poll, Speak Time, and Hand Raise analytics by date range.

Microphone Issues - Basic Troubleshooting
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

If you're having issues with speaking to your tablemates and/or class, make sure your microphone is on and you have given Engageli permission to connect.

 

Instructions

1. Check that you are using a computer or laptop to run class. We currently do not support mobile or tablet devices. If you are using one of these, please join Engageli via a laptop, computer, or Chromebook.

2. Check that you are on an Engageli-supported browser. We currently do not recommend Safari or Firefox browsers. If you are using one of these, please join Engageli via the latest version of Google Chrome, Edge, or a browser on Chromium (Opera, Vivaldi, Brave). If needed, try switching to a different browser. If you are using Chrome, try using Edge or another supported browser, or vice versa.

3. Refresh the browser. Sometimes, simply refreshing the browser resolves a camera issue.

4. Check your computer’s permissions (Mac | Windows). Check the privacy and security settings for your computer’s Microphone, and make sure they are set to On and that desktop apps have access to the Microphone.

What’s the difference between the ‘Link to class’ and ‘Link to file’ options in the Recordings section of the portal?
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone
As an instructor, you can access a recording of your Engageli class in the Playback room or download the file directly. Follow the steps below to access links to your class recordings.

1. Login to the Engageli portal.

2. Find your class under Classes (Class Management in v3.0), then click Recordings and you will see a list of all recordings.

 

 

3. Select Link to class to be directed to a link of the class recording in the Engageli Playback room. The recording in the Playback room will display any polls run during the class, and learners viewing the recording asynchronously will be able to participate in the polls. The notes that learners take during class and answers to Q&A questions persist in the Playback room to provide an optimal viewing experience for learners. You can access all recordings directly from the same Engageli classroom link that you use for your live classes. 

Attendance is recorded and can be viewed in the Admin Portal for learners who watch the class recording in an Engageli Playback room. 

 

4. Select Link to file to access an MP4 file of the recording. Unlike the recording in the Engageli Playback room, the MP4 file does not display poll results. You can convert the file as needed and upload it to a video hosting platform such as YouTube, Vimeo, or Kaltura. If you want to copy the link, click the file link directly and allow it to open in a new browser window. If you right-click and copy the link, learners will have to authenticate and view the recording in an Engageli Playback room.

Attendance is not recorded for learners who watch a shared MP4 file of the class recording.

 

Note: Before sharing recordings with the class, please check the FERPA guidelines at your institution. Playback rooms can be accessed through the same class link that authenticates learners to enter the live session. The mp4 recordings can be downloaded by anyone if they have the link and can be shared externally.

Engageli tables are strategically designed to increase collaboration between learners. Tables are built so learners will always be in small groups and you do not need to create breakout rooms for group activities. This allows you to create rich learning experiences at the tables while learners also feel simultaneously connected to the larger class and the instructor.

 

Joining Tables

Creating Random Tables Groups 

Moving learners to different Tables

 

Joining Tables

Joining tables allows you to leave the podium and “visit” groups of learners at tables, much like “walking the room” in an in-person class. This is great for any group work or discussions.

Instructions
1. To join a table, click the Tables tab.
2. Hover over the table that you'd like to join and click the JOIN button.

When you join the table, you will see, hear, and interact only with members of the table you joined. This is great when groups have a question on an in-class assignment and you don't want to interrupt the entire class.

3. When you are ready to leave the table, click the Back to podium button. Engageli 3.1 users have several options for returning to the podium.

Note: The audio will automatically switch from Room Mode to Table Mode. When you leave the table, you will have to switch the audio setting back to Room Mode to enable a full-class discussion. Click to learn more about the audio settings.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors will peek at or observe tables unobtrusively without disturbing the learners. 

 
Creating Random Tables Groups 

This is a great way to encourage learner engagement is to randomly arrange table groups for discussions. 

Instructions

1. Go to the Seating Arrangement drop-down menu in the Tables view. 

2. Select Random Arrangement Table Size.

3. Choose the number of learners you would like at each table. The system will automatically break learners into randomized groups.

You can also reserve any of the first 3 tables for staff or other participants who you don't want to move during the random arrangement. In Engageli 3.0, this is called Skip Tables.

Note: If learners have a reservation, then they will be treated as learners. Make sure to remove any reservations before you do this! (See instructions on reservations here).

You can save the table arrangement you created as a preset that you can use again. Click for information on how to create a table preset during a class.

 

Moving Learners to Different Tables 

Instructions
1. Navigate to the Tables view.
2. Click the profile icon of the learner you wish to move.

3. Choose a new table for the learner from the drop-down menu.

4. Or, you can simply drag and drop the learner to a different table.

Camera Issues - PC
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

 

Camera issues can happen for a number of reasons. First, check that your camera is on and that you've granted camera permissions.

If that doesn't work, we're here to help!

Click here if you use a Mac. 

 

Granting Camera Permission during Class 

Granting Camera Permission from Browser

Granting Camera Permission from Computer

Is an Anti-Virus Disabling Your Camera?

 

 

Checking Your Camera During Class 

1. Make sure the camera image indicates that your camera is on. If the camera icon is red, then your camera is off.

 

2. Check that you have connected the correct camera to the Engageli classroom through Settings (gear icon).

 

Granting Permission to Use Camera from Browser

 

Google Chrome

1. Click "Allow" on the pop-up permission prompt when you first log into your class. 

 

2. If you do not see this option, click on the lock icon in the top left corner of your screen next to your address bar. Make sure the camera is toggled to "Allow."

 

 

Edge

1. Click"Allow" on the pop-up permission prompters when you first log into your class.

 

2. If this is not an option, click on the lock icon in the top left corner of your screen next to your address bar. Ensure from this menu that your camera is set to "Allow."





 

Granting Permission to Use Camera from Computer (PC)

 

1. Go to your system settings, which you can find by searching "settings" in your finder.

 

 

2. Next, click on "Privacy" from the resulting menu.

 

3. Click "Camera" from the privacy menu.

4. Make sure that your camera is allowed on your device (which is the default), and that "Allow apps to access your camera" is toggled on.

 

 

5. Next, scroll down to "Allow desktop apps to access your camera," and ensure that this is toggled on. You should see Engageli on this list.

 

 

 

Is an Anti Virus Disabling Your Camera?

If none of the above steps solve the camera issue, it is possible that an anti-virus application is disabling your camera. The Kaspersky Anti-Virus software is most commonly seen.

Windows

1. Go to the taskbar and search for the application "Kapersky Internet Security."

Screen Sharing Issues with Instructor Application - Mac
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

If you use a Mac and cannot share your screen with the class, you need to allow Engageli to screen record and screen share in the system preferences. You will still be able to "share," but you'll notice that nothing will appear in your screen share preview, and learners will not be able to see your screen share.

 

Note: You’ll know this applies to you if when you click “SHARE” most of the items are grayed out or blank. 

 

Using the Instructor Application

Sharing Settings

 

Using the Instructor Application

 1. To grant permission to share your screen on a Mac computer, click on the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

 

2. Select "System Preferences" from the drop-down menu.

 

3. Select "Security & Privacy" from the pop-up window.

 

4. Under the Privacy tab, scroll down and select "Screen Recording." Ensure that the Engageli icon is checked.

 

5. You will likely be prompted to restart the application for this change to take effect. If you need to do this during class, learners will not be impacted. They will be able to stay logged into the class until you return. 

 

 

Sharing Settings

1. To check your “Sharing” settings, click on the Apple icon in the top left corner of your screen.

2. Select “System Preferences” from the drop-down menu.

3. Click “Sharing” from the pop-up window.

 


4. Check the box for “Screen Sharing” if it is not already selected. 

Note: If the box for “Remote Management” is checked, you might not be able to share your entire screen on Engageli, and will need to contact an Administrator at your institution. However, you will be able to share browser tabs.

 

You should now be able to share your screen with the class, but if you are still having trouble you should answer the following questions:

 

1. What device are you using? We currently do not support mobile or tablet devices. If a user is on one of these, instruct them to join via laptop, computer, or Chromebook.

2. Do you have 3rd party anti-virus software that is blocking screen sharing? Check your 3rd party anti-virus software.

3. Did your permissions get reset? Sometimes permissions are reset without any notification, so recheck your settings to make sure Engageli has permission to share and record your screen.

If none of this works, reach out to our Support team.

You can also use the PDF Live share to share a presentation directly in Engageli without sharing your screen.

Logging into Your Classroom

For users who have a class/institution portal or Learning Management System (LMS) such as Canvas, Blackboard, or Moodle:

Log into your LMS on Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.

Find your class.

Click the link to open the Engageli classroom.

Note: Saving the classroom link will NOT allow you to access the class at a future date, you must authenticate through your LMS to log in.

For users who do not have an LMS, access the class with the link provided by your instructor.

 
Setting up Permissions

The first time you enter a classroom, you will be required to allow permissions at a browser level and sometimes at a system level.

Browser Permissions

Click REQUEST PERMISSIONS. If you don’t see the REQUEST PERMISSIONS button, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.

You will see a pop-up on the left asking you to grant Camera access to Engageli. Click Allow.

Next, you will see a pop-up on the left asking you to grant Microphone access to Engageli. Click Allow.

If you accidentally clicked “Block” in either of the pop-ups, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.

Make sure that the settings for the Camera and Microphone are both set to On/Allow.

System Permissions

If your system has not enabled browser access to your camera and microphone, you will be prompted to open System Preferences or (a drop-down notification will appear on the right of your URL bar).

Click Open Preferences or the Apple logo in the top left corner of the screen.

Click System Preferences.

Select Security & Privacy.

Click the lock icon at the bottom of the window to make changes.

Enter your password to unlock.

Select Camera from the menu on the left.

Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).

Select “Later” when prompted to quit & reopen Microsoft Edge.

Select Microphone from the menu on the left.

Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).

Select “Later” when prompted to quit & reopen Microsoft Edge.

Select Screen Recordings from the menu on the left.

Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).

Select Quit & Reopen to apply changes.

Go back to your Engageli classroom.

Note: If you don’t see the Quit & Reopen pop-up, you’ll need to manually quit Microsoft Edge (Cmd +Q), and then reopen it.

Classroom Audio Settings
3 months ago Updated

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the learner view in the audio modes has changed. Click to understand more about Room Mode and Table Mode and how to effectively use Engageli's audio modes to foster active learning and collaboration. 

Engageli now has two main audio modes, Room Mode and Table Mode.

Room Mode:

This is the default when you enter your Engageli classroom. This means that as the instructor you will hear the audio feeds from all learners, and they will hear each other, regardless of where they are seated.

When to use: the beginning of class, or entire classroom discussions

 

Table Mode:

When you enable Table Mode, learners will hear only their table mates and you will only hear learners who raise their hands. 

When to use: small group discussions, projects, and other table activities

 

You can easily toggle between the two modes from the bottom right corner of the screen.

  

If you or a co-instructor join a table, Engageli automatically switches to Table Mode. When at a table, you will only hear the learners at that table (and any learners at other tables that raise their hands).  While an instructor is at a table, no instructor will be able to change the mode to Room Mode. 

For learners, the tablemates panel will automatically close when switching the audio mode to Room mode from the Table audio mode so learners direct their attention back to the class.

If you would like to hear all the learners concurrently while at the podium in Table Mode, click on the three dots and choose ‘Hear tables while on podium in table mode’. 

 

 

You can hover over the Table Mode and Room Mode buttons to see who you can hear and who can hear you. 





Note: All audio will be recorded in Room Mode and only those on podium (learners with hands raised or instructor(s)) will be recorded in Table Mode.

 

Click to learn how to add a tag to your presentation for a reminder to switch between Room Mode and Table Mode.

3 months ago Updated

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the learner view in the audio modes has changed. Click to understand more about Room Mode and Table Mode and how to effectively use Engageli's audio modes to foster active learning and collaboration. 

Engageli now has two main audio modes, Room Mode and Table Mode.

Room Mode:

This is the default when you enter your Engageli classroom. This means that as the instructor you will hear the audio feeds from all learners, and they will hear each other, regardless of where they are seated.

When to use: the beginning of class, or entire classroom discussions

 

Table Mode:

When you enable Table Mode, learners will hear only their table mates and you will only hear learners who raise their hands. 

When to use: small group discussions, projects, and other table activities

 

You can easily toggle between the two modes from the bottom right corner of the screen.

  

If you or a co-instructor join a table, Engageli automatically switches to Table Mode. When at a table, you will only hear the learners at that table (and any learners at other tables that raise their hands).  While an instructor is at a table, no instructor will be able to change the mode to Room Mode. 

For learners, the tablemates panel will automatically close when switching the audio mode to Room mode from the Table audio mode so learners direct their attention back to the class.

If you would like to hear all the learners concurrently while at the podium in Table Mode, click on the three dots and choose ‘Hear tables while on podium in table mode’. 

 

 

You can hover over the Table Mode and Room Mode buttons to see who you can hear and who can hear you. 





Note: All audio will be recorded in Room Mode and only those on podium (learners with hands raised or instructor(s)) will be recorded in Table Mode.

 

Click to learn how to add a tag to your presentation for a reminder to switch between Room Mode and Table Mode.

How to Record and Share Class Recordings
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

 It's easy to record and share class recordings within Engageli so you and your learners can revisit class discussions, content, and material as needed!

Recording Settings (Pre-Class)

1. To access recording settings, go to the Admin Portal. 

2. Click Classes [Class Management in Engageli 3.0] on the left to expand the menu. 

3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class. 

4. Click Details.

5. Select the Configuration tab.

6. Check Record learners' videos if you want to include in the class recordings the video feeds of learners who raise their hands to join the podium. If this option is unchecked, only the learners' audio will be captured in the recording.  

7. Check Auto start recording if you want the recording to automatically start after you log in and launch the classroom. This is helpful in case you forget to start the class recording.

Note: Settings will persist between class sessions. This means the setting(s) you selected most recently will be the default for future classes unless you change it. 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors and admins have options to record the Class Gallery and make the recording private by default.

 

Recording During Class 

1. Once the class has started, click the green dot (Record Lecture) to begin recording. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button at the bottom of the screen. 

2. While recording, you can pause, stop, or continue the recording at any time.  

3. If you want to pause the recording, click the red dot (Stop Recording). Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button to pause. 

4. If/when you want to resume the recording, click the green dot (Record Lecture) again. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button again to resume.

5. The recording will stop when class ends.

After class, a link to the recording will be emailed to the email address that you used to sign into Engageli. Each instructor listed on the roster will receive the email. The recording link is sent from a "do not reply" address, so if you don’t see it within five minutes to one hour, please check your Spam folder. 

Click here to learn which components are included in the class recording and ways you can optimize the recording for asynchronous learning in the Playback Room.

Recording Indicator 

When the class is being recorded, a red dot will appear in the top right corner of the instructor's video. Learners and instructors on the browser will see the following:

 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, in addition to the red dot, all users will see and hear a notification whenever the recording starts or is paused.

Recordings After Class

After class, you can access recordings in the Admin Portal. 

1. Under your class, go to Recordings and you will see a list of all recordings.

2. You can easily change the name of the recordings by clicking the titles listed under Name. 

3. If needed, you can delete a recording by selecting the checkbox to the left of the name, and then clicking the Delete icon in the upper right corner of the screen.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the Recordings List in the Admin Portal has been enhanced to provide more options for instructors including making recordings private and uploading 3rd party transcripts.

Playback Rooms 

Learners can easily review class recordings in the Playback Room. Playback Rooms are open classrooms where learners can, independently or in a group of up to 10, access class content and engage with the material. Learners can review class recordings, participate in polls, ask and answer questions in the Q&A, take notes, and - if in a group - chat, talk, and learn together.

Using the same link for logging into the live class, learners select "Playback room" at the top of the screen. Click here to learn more.

How to Optimize Your Class Recording for Asynchronous Learning
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

When recording a class on Engageli, follow the guidelines below to ensure an optimized recording for asynchronous learning in the Playback room.

 

Included in the recording	NOT included in the recording:
Instructor audio/video	Instructor audio/video when visiting tables
Learner audio/video the podium (raised hands)	Learner video while at tables
Learner audio in Room Mode	Conversations at tables in Table Mode
Screen shares to the entire class	Screen shares to tables
Panels	Learner reactions (thumbs up/down)
Video clips	Miro whiteboard
Polls/quizzes	Shared table documents
Engageli class whiteboards	 
Engageli table whiteboards*	 
Shared class documents	 
Class Gallery*	 

 

Class Materials 

If you are not sharing materials such as a presentation deck or document during the class, your instructor video will appear in a large view in the recording. If you do not want to appear in a large view in the recording, then you should continue to share your screen.

Learner Video

Learners' video feeds in the Class Gallery under My View are not recorded by default for privacy reasons. You can enable the recording of the Class Gallery in the Admin Portal. Click here to learn how class recordings can be configured to include or exclude your learners’ video feeds or the Class Gallery [Engageli 3.1 only].

Learner Audio

In Room Mode, which is the Engageli default, learners will be recorded regardless of whether they raise their hands or not. Room Mode captures all audio in the classroom. 
Discussions that happen at the tables when Table Mode is enabled are not recorded.

Tables and Group Activities 

If you are doing group activities, and are visiting tables, the recording will not pause automatically. If you are conducting group activities within the tables, you should pause the recording until you regroup so that there is no blank air time. 

Collaborative Features

If you run a poll during your class, as an ice breaker or to check for understanding, learners watching the recording can also participate in the poll. After you turn on the poll, the poll will be displayed in the recording. If you want asynchronous learners to see the live results, click "Share Results" in the live session. Asynchronous learners will need to answer the poll before seeing the live results.
Any questions posted in the Q&A during the live class will be displayed in the Playback Room. Learners watching the recording can answer the same questions that were posed in the live session. The questions will appear to any learner who attended, whether during the live session or viewing the recording in the Playback Room.
Messages sent in the Chat are not included in the recording and do not persist in the Playback room.
If you distribute a Class or Table Whiteboard to learners during the session, these will be included in the recording. We recommend instructing asynchronous learners to replicate any whiteboard activities done in the live class, as the host can open a whiteboard in the Playback Room.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors can change their settings to include the Class Gallery in recordings. Table whiteboards are also included in the class recording when viewed in an Engageli Playback Room.

How to Lock/Unlock A Classroom
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

When a classroom is Locked, it is not in session and is closed. Learners cannot enter a locked classroom without having an instructor logged in.

When a classroom is Unlocked, learners can enter without having an instructor logged in.

Engageli classrooms are unlocked by default. 

To unlock a classroom:

Go to the Admin Portal.

Click Classes (Class Management in v3.0) on the left to expand the menu.

Select your class or use the search field to find your class.

Click the class name.

Click Unlock Class in the upper right corner. 

When an Engageli class is not in session, it is considered “locked” or closed. This means that you can edit your roster, create table presets, name tables, add video clips to be shared, and upload documents to be distributed during class.

When an Engageli class is in session, it is considered “unlocked.” You can still access the class settings through the Portal but you will have some limitations as to what changes you can make.

 

 

You need to “lock” or end the class in order to:

Delete or edit users from the roster. 
Change a learner’s gallery position or group table.
Change table names.
Add tables.
Remove tables
Add or remove table presets
Add or edit materials
Edit sub-rooms
Enable guest links.

You can choose to lock the class in order to make any of the above changes, but doing so will end the class and remove the learners from the classroom. 

Note: When the class is “unlocked” or in session, you can still add people to the roster, but you can’t delete them or edit their roles (instructor, TA, student).

3 months ago Updated

Logging into Your Classroom

For users who have a class/institution portal or Learning Management System (LMS) such as Canvas, Blackboard, or Moodle:

Log into your LMS on Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.

Find your class.

Click the link to open the Engageli classroom.

Note: Saving the classroom link will NOT allow you to access the class at a future date, you must authenticate through your LMS to log in.

For users who do not have an LMS, access the class with the link provided by your instructor.

 

Setting up Permissions

The first time you enter a classroom, you will be required to allow permissions at a browser level and sometimes at a system level.

Browser Permissions

Click REQUEST PERMISSIONS. If you don’t see the REQUEST PERMISSIONS button, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.

You will see a pop-up on the left asking you to grant Camera access to Engageli. Click Allow.

Next, you will see a pop up on the left asking you to grant Microphone access to Engageli. Click Allow.

If you accidentally clicked “Block” in either of the pop-ups, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.

Make sure that the settings for Camera and Microphone are both set to On/Allow.

System Permissions

If your system has not enabled browser access to your camera and microphone, you will be prompted to open System Preferences or (a drop-down notification will appear on the right of your URL bar).

Click Open Preferences or the Apple logo in the top left corner of the screen.

Click System Preferences.

Select Security & Privacy.

Click the lock icon at the bottom of the window to make changes.

Enter your password to unlock.

Select Camera from the menu on the left.

Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).

Select “Later” when prompted to quit & reopen Microsoft Edge.

Select Microphone from the menu on the left.

Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).

Select “Later” when prompted to quit & reopen Microsoft Edge.

Select Screen Recordings from the menu on the left.

Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).

Select Quit & Reopen to apply changes.

Go back to your Engageli classroom.

Note: If you don’t see the Quit & Reopen pop-up, you’ll need to manually quit Microsoft Edge (Cmd +Q), and then reopen it.

How to Manage the Chat
5 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Instructors in virtual classrooms have to balance presenting their educational material, navigating the features of the platform as well as holding their learners' attention and keeping them engaged. Engageli’s Chat feature allows instructors to communicate directly with learners, and learners to communicate directly with each other. Here are some tips for managing the chat so you can foster communication and engagement and conduct your Engageli session with ease.

1. Learn your chat channels

Everyone - All participants in the class

Staff - All instructors and TAs in the class

TAs - All users logged in as TAs

Learner name - Specific learner

Table – If you change the table names, you will see the customized table names in the chat channels menu.

2. Set ground rules

Learners might use the chat to carry on discussions unrelated to the class session. Establish ground rules a the beginning of the session if you have rules you want the learners to follow such as keeping side conversations to a minimum or not overusing emojis, acronyms, shorthand, etc.

3. Post Questions in the Q&A

If you have questions for your learners that you don’t want to get lost in the chat, you can post them in the Q&A. The Q&A is threaded, persists, and asynchronous learners watching the class recording in the Playback Room will also be able to participate. Like the chat, the Q&A can be downloaded.

4. Designate a Moderator

If you have teaching assistants (TA), you can assign them or another learner to be the moderator and keep track of the chat. The chat moderator can answer questions without distracting from a presentation or lecture and also alert you to pertinent questions or comments via a private chat to you or the “Staff” channel.

5. Download the chat for later review

During a session, learners may actively participate in the chat, posting questions, responding, and helping each other. If you are not able to keep up with the chat in real-time, you can download the chat at the end of class for later review so that you can address any outstanding questions or issues in the next class.

Using Playback Rooms for Collaboration Spaces and Group Work (v3.1)
24 days ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Playback Rooms are extensions of the Engageli classroom where learners, TAs, and instructors can access and engage with class recordings, modules, and other course material independently or in a group. Playback Rooms are open 24/7 and learners can use them to create online collaborative spaces and complete the assigned tasks together.

 

Accessing the Playback Room

You can access the Playback Room directly from the same link that you use for your live Engageli classes. 

1. Open the classroom URL and select Playback room at the top of the screen.

2. Then, click Start my Playback room. 

Create a Collaboration Space for My Group

The first step for creating a Collaboration Space is to get the invite link for your Playback room. 

1. In your Playback room, click By Invitation in the bottom left corner.

2. Click Copy invite link. 

You can send the link to your peers as well as guests.

 

Instructions for Engageli 3.41: The first step for creating a Collaboration Space is to create a permanent link for the Playback room. 

1. In your Playback Room, click the Invite & Info icon in the bottom left corner.

2. Click Create Permanent Link. 

3. Once the Permanent Link is created, you can copy it to share with your peers as well as guests. 

 Create a Collaboration Space for Anyone to Join

By default, Playback rooms are set to Private, which means that a user needs a guest link from the room in order to join. If set to Open (or Public Mode), your Playback room appears on the login screen for your classmates and peers and they will be able to join without a guest link.

To set the room to Open:

1. Click By invitation in the bottom left corner. 

2. Select Open. 

In Engageli 3.1.41, to set the room to Public Mode, select Private Mode in the bottom left corner and then switch to Public Mode.

This is how public Playback rooms appear to users. 

As the host who started the group, you will retain the playback controls. That means you will control which class recording, video, or assignment is selected for review. To pass the playback controls to another participant:

1. Click the Gallery button at the bottom of the screen.

2. Then click the three-dot menu in the person's video feed.

3. Click Make Host.

Playback Room Features

In addition to watching class recordings and videos, you can

Review and take notes.
Ask and answer questions from class in the Q&A.
Open a whiteboard for brainstorming, sketching, and diagramming.
Complete Modules.
Use the PDF share.
Screen Share.
View the transcript of a class recording.
Chat with other users in the Playback room. 

 

Note: Click here to learn more about using Engageli Playback Rooms.

What’s the difference between the ‘Link to class’ and ‘Link to file’ options in the Recordings section of the portal?
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone
As an instructor, you can access a recording of your Engageli class in the Playback room or download the file directly. Follow the steps below to access links to your class recordings.

1. Login to the Engageli portal.

2. Find your class under Classes (Class Management in v3.0), then click Recordings and you will see a list of all recordings.

 

 

3. Select Link to class to be directed to a link of the class recording in the Engageli Playback room. The recording in the Playback room will display any polls run during the class, and learners viewing the recording asynchronously will be able to participate in the polls. The notes that learners take during class and answers to Q&A questions persist in the Playback room to provide an optimal viewing experience for learners. You can access all recordings directly from the same Engageli classroom link that you use for your live classes. 

Attendance is recorded and can be viewed in the Admin Portal for learners who watch the class recording in an Engageli Playback room. 

 

4. Select Link to file to access an MP4 file of the recording. Unlike the recording in the Engageli Playback room, the MP4 file does not display poll results. You can convert the file as needed and upload it to a video hosting platform such as YouTube, Vimeo, or Kaltura. If you want to copy the link, click the file link directly and allow it to open in a new browser window. If you right-click and copy the link, learners will have to authenticate and view the recording in an Engageli Playback room.

Attendance is not recorded for learners who watch a shared MP4 file of the class recording.

 

Note: Before sharing recordings with the class, please check the FERPA guidelines at your institution. Playback rooms can be accessed through the same class link that authenticates learners to enter the live session. The mp4 recordings can be downloaded by anyone if they have the link and can be shared externally.

How to Record and Share Class Recordings
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

 It's easy to record and share class recordings within Engageli so you and your learners can revisit class discussions, content, and material as needed!

Recording Settings (Pre-Class)

1. To access recording settings, go to the Admin Portal. 

2. Click Classes [Class Management in Engageli 3.0] on the left to expand the menu. 

3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class. 

4. Click Details.

5. Select the Configuration tab.

6. Check Record learners' videos if you want to include in the class recordings the video feeds of learners who raise their hands to join the podium. If this option is unchecked, only the learners' audio will be captured in the recording.  

7. Check Auto start recording if you want the recording to automatically start after you log in and launch the classroom. This is helpful in case you forget to start the class recording.

Note: Settings will persist between class sessions. This means the setting(s) you selected most recently will be the default for future classes unless you change it. 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors and admins have options to record the Class Gallery and make the recording private by default.

 

Recording During Class 

1. Once the class has started, click the green dot (Record Lecture) to begin recording. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button at the bottom of the screen. 

2. While recording, you can pause, stop, or continue the recording at any time.  

3. If you want to pause the recording, click the red dot (Stop Recording). Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button to pause. 

4. If/when you want to resume the recording, click the green dot (Record Lecture) again. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button again to resume.

5. The recording will stop when class ends.

After class, a link to the recording will be emailed to the email address that you used to sign into Engageli. Each instructor listed on the roster will receive the email. The recording link is sent from a "do not reply" address, so if you don’t see it within five minutes to one hour, please check your Spam folder. 

Click here to learn which components are included in the class recording and ways you can optimize the recording for asynchronous learning in the Playback Room.

Recording Indicator 

When the class is being recorded, a red dot will appear in the top right corner of the instructor's video. Learners and instructors on the browser will see the following:

 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, in addition to the red dot, all users will see and hear a notification whenever the recording starts or is paused.

Recordings After Class

After class, you can access recordings in the Admin Portal. 

1. Under your class, go to Recordings and you will see a list of all recordings.

2. You can easily change the name of the recordings by clicking the titles listed under Name. 

3. If needed, you can delete a recording by selecting the checkbox to the left of the name, and then clicking the Delete icon in the upper right corner of the screen.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the Recordings List in the Admin Portal has been enhanced to provide more options for instructors including making recordings private and uploading 3rd party transcripts.

Playback Rooms 

Learners can easily review class recordings in the Playback Room. Playback Rooms are open classrooms where learners can, independently or in a group of up to 10, access class content and engage with the material. Learners can review class recordings, participate in polls, ask and answer questions in the Q&A, take notes, and - if in a group - chat, talk, and learn together.

Using the same link for logging into the live class, learners select "Playback room" at the top of the screen. Click here to learn more.

Instructions for Engageli 3.1

To share your screen while teaching on Engageli via Chrome, Edge, or Brave, follow these steps:

1. Make sure the window you want to share is open and not minimized.

2. Click the Present button in the middle of your instructor controls at the bottom of the screen.

3. Under Classroom activities, click Screen Share.

4. Choose either Browser Tab, Window, or Entire Screen.

Browser TabWindowEntire Screen
Select the tab that you want to share. Once highlighted, the Share button will become enabled. 

5. Click Share.

6. Your view will switch to what you are sharing. 

7. In Engageli, your view will default to the Class Gallery. You can see your screen share in the green Screen Sharing with Class window, which you can collapse. 

8. If you want to annotate the screen share, you can click the Annotate Screen button in the Screen Sharing with Class window, or select the Class Share tab at the top and click Annotate Screen.

9. To stop sharing, choose one of 4 options:

Click the Stop sharing button at the top of the screen if you're sharing a browser tab.
Click the Stop Class Share button in the middle of the screen on the Class Share tab. 
Click the Stop Class Share button in the middle of the My Screen Preview window.                          
Click the Present button, and then STOP. 

Click to learn how to annotate a screen share.
