Camera Issues - PC
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

 

Camera issues can happen for a number of reasons. First, check that your camera is on and that you've granted camera permissions.

If that doesn't work, we're here to help!

Click here if you use a Mac. 

 

Granting Camera Permission during Class 

Granting Camera Permission from Browser

Granting Camera Permission from Computer

Is an Anti-Virus Disabling Your Camera?

 

 

Checking Your Camera During Class 

1. Make sure the camera image indicates that your camera is on. If the camera icon is red, then your camera is off.

 

2. Check that you have connected the correct camera to the Engageli classroom through Settings (gear icon).

 

Granting Permission to Use Camera from Browser

 

Google Chrome

1. Click "Allow" on the pop-up permission prompt when you first log into your class. 

 

2. If you do not see this option, click on the lock icon in the top left corner of your screen next to your address bar. Make sure the camera is toggled to "Allow."

 

 

Edge

1. Click"Allow" on the pop-up permission prompters when you first log into your class.

 

2. If this is not an option, click on the lock icon in the top left corner of your screen next to your address bar. Ensure from this menu that your camera is set to "Allow."





 

Granting Permission to Use Camera from Computer (PC)

 

1. Go to your system settings, which you can find by searching "settings" in your finder.

 

 

2. Next, click on "Privacy" from the resulting menu.

 

3. Click "Camera" from the privacy menu.

4. Make sure that your camera is allowed on your device (which is the default), and that "Allow apps to access your camera" is toggled on.

 

 

5. Next, scroll down to "Allow desktop apps to access your camera," and ensure that this is toggled on. You should see Engageli on this list.

 

 

 

Is an Anti Virus Disabling Your Camera?

If none of the above steps solve the camera issue, it is possible that an anti-virus application is disabling your camera. The Kaspersky Anti-Virus software is most commonly seen.

Windows

1. Go to the taskbar and search for the application "Kapersky Internet Security."

2. Navigate to "Privacy Protection" and click on "Webcam Protection." 

 

3. Clicking on the link will reveal checkable boxes. Be sure that "Block access to webcam for all applications" is not marked with a check.

 

4. You can then restart your computer and try using your webcam again.

Using Playback Rooms for Collaboration Spaces and Group Work (v3.1)
24 days ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Playback Rooms are extensions of the Engageli classroom where learners, TAs, and instructors can access and engage with class recordings, modules, and other course material independently or in a group. Playback Rooms are open 24/7 and learners can use them to create online collaborative spaces and complete the assigned tasks together.

 

Accessing the Playback Room

You can access the Playback Room directly from the same link that you use for your live Engageli classes. 

1. Open the classroom URL and select Playback room at the top of the screen.

2. Then, click Start my Playback room. 

Create a Collaboration Space for My Group

The first step for creating a Collaboration Space is to get the invite link for your Playback room. 

1. In your Playback room, click By Invitation in the bottom left corner.

2. Click Copy invite link. 

You can send the link to your peers as well as guests.

 

Instructions for Engageli 3.41: The first step for creating a Collaboration Space is to create a permanent link for the Playback room. 

1. In your Playback Room, click the Invite & Info icon in the bottom left corner.

2. Click Create Permanent Link. 

3. Once the Permanent Link is created, you can copy it to share with your peers as well as guests. 

 Create a Collaboration Space for Anyone to Join

By default, Playback rooms are set to Private, which means that a user needs a guest link from the room in order to join. If set to Open (or Public Mode), your Playback room appears on the login screen for your classmates and peers and they will be able to join without a guest link.

To set the room to Open:

1. Click By invitation in the bottom left corner. 

2. Select Open. 

In Engageli 3.1.41, to set the room to Public Mode, select Private Mode in the bottom left corner and then switch to Public Mode.

This is how public Playback rooms appear to users. 

As the host who started the group, you will retain the playback controls. That means you will control which class recording, video, or assignment is selected for review. To pass the playback controls to another participant:

1. Click the Gallery button at the bottom of the screen.

2. Then click the three-dot menu in the person's video feed.

3. Click Make Host.

Playback Room Features

In addition to watching class recordings and videos, you can

Review and take notes.
Ask and answer questions from class in the Q&A.
Open a whiteboard for brainstorming, sketching, and diagramming.
Complete Modules.
Use the PDF share.
Screen Share.
View the transcript of a class recording.
Chat with other users in the Playback room. 

 

Note: Click here to learn more about using Engageli Playback Rooms.

In version 3.1: If no schedule has been set, we will automatically create sessions if an instructor was in class for more than 15 minutes and the recorder was on. Automatically created sessions will appear in the Analytics section of the portal. If you'd like to clear out the automatically created sessions, simply add in the times and days that your class is scheduled.

To check attendance for your class:

1. Go to the Admin Portal.
2. Click Classes on the left to expand the menu.
3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class.
4. Click Analytics.

How to Record and Share Class Recordings
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

 It's easy to record and share class recordings within Engageli so you and your learners can revisit class discussions, content, and material as needed!

Recording Settings (Pre-Class)

1. To access recording settings, go to the Admin Portal. 

2. Click Classes [Class Management in Engageli 3.0] on the left to expand the menu. 

3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class. 

4. Click Details.

5. Select the Configuration tab.

6. Check Record learners' videos if you want to include in the class recordings the video feeds of learners who raise their hands to join the podium. If this option is unchecked, only the learners' audio will be captured in the recording.  

7. Check Auto start recording if you want the recording to automatically start after you log in and launch the classroom. This is helpful in case you forget to start the class recording.

Note: Settings will persist between class sessions. This means the setting(s) you selected most recently will be the default for future classes unless you change it. 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors and admins have options to record the Class Gallery and make the recording private by default.

 

Recording During Class 

1. Once the class has started, click the green dot (Record Lecture) to begin recording. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button at the bottom of the screen. 

2. While recording, you can pause, stop, or continue the recording at any time.  

3. If you want to pause the recording, click the red dot (Stop Recording). Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button to pause. 

4. If/when you want to resume the recording, click the green dot (Record Lecture) again. Engageli 3.1 users click the Record button again to resume.

5. The recording will stop when class ends.

After class, a link to the recording will be emailed to the email address that you used to sign into Engageli. Each instructor listed on the roster will receive the email. The recording link is sent from a "do not reply" address, so if you don’t see it within five minutes to one hour, please check your Spam folder. 

Click here to learn which components are included in the class recording and ways you can optimize the recording for asynchronous learning in the Playback Room.

Recording Indicator 

When the class is being recorded, a red dot will appear in the top right corner of the instructor's video. Learners and instructors on the browser will see the following:

 

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, in addition to the red dot, all users will see and hear a notification whenever the recording starts or is paused.

Recordings After Class

After class, you can access recordings in the Admin Portal. 

1. Under your class, go to Recordings and you will see a list of all recordings.

2. You can easily change the name of the recordings by clicking the titles listed under Name. 

3. If needed, you can delete a recording by selecting the checkbox to the left of the name, and then clicking the Delete icon in the upper right corner of the screen.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the Recordings List in the Admin Portal has been enhanced to provide more options for instructors including making recordings private and uploading 3rd party transcripts.

Playback Rooms 

Learners can easily review class recordings in the Playback Room. Playback Rooms are open classrooms where learners can, independently or in a group of up to 10, access class content and engage with the material. Learners can review class recordings, participate in polls, ask and answer questions in the Q&A, take notes, and - if in a group - chat, talk, and learn together.

Using the same link for logging into the live class, learners select "Playback room" at the top of the screen. Click here to learn more.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, the learner view in the audio modes has changed. Click to understand more about Room Mode and Table Mode and how to effectively use Engageli's audio modes to foster active learning and collaboration. 

Engageli now has two main audio modes, Room Mode and Table Mode.

Room Mode:

This is the default when you enter your Engageli classroom. This means that as the instructor you will hear the audio feeds from all learners, and they will hear each other, regardless of where they are seated.

When to use: the beginning of class, or entire classroom discussions

 

Table Mode:

When you enable Table Mode, learners will hear only their table mates and you will only hear learners who raise their hands. 

When to use: small group discussions, projects, and other table activities

 

You can easily toggle between the two modes from the bottom right corner of the screen.

  

If you or a co-instructor join a table, Engageli automatically switches to Table Mode. When at a table, you will only hear the learners at that table (and any learners at other tables that raise their hands).  While an instructor is at a table, no instructor will be able to change the mode to Room Mode. 

For learners, the tablemates panel will automatically close when switching the audio mode to Room mode from the Table audio mode so learners direct their attention back to the class.

If you would like to hear all the learners concurrently while at the podium in Table Mode, click on the three dots and choose ‘Hear tables while on podium in table mode’. 

 

 

You can hover over the Table Mode and Room Mode buttons to see who you can hear and who can hear you. 





Note: All audio will be recorded in Room Mode and only those on podium (learners with hands raised or instructor(s)) will be recorded in Table Mode.

 

Click to learn how to add a tag to your presentation for a reminder to switch between Room Mode and Table Mode.

How to Optimize Your Class Recording for Asynchronous Learning
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

When recording a class on Engageli, follow the guidelines below to ensure an optimized recording for asynchronous learning in the Playback room.

 

Included in the recording	NOT included in the recording:
Instructor audio/video	Instructor audio/video when visiting tables
Learner audio/video the podium (raised hands)	Learner video while at tables
Learner audio in Room Mode	Conversations at tables in Table Mode
Screen shares to the entire class	Screen shares to tables
Panels	Learner reactions (thumbs up/down)
Video clips	Miro whiteboard
Polls/quizzes	Shared table documents
Engageli class whiteboards	 
Engageli table whiteboards*	 
Shared class documents	 
Class Gallery*	 

 

Class Materials 

If you are not sharing materials such as a presentation deck or document during the class, your instructor video will appear in a large view in the recording. If you do not want to appear in a large view in the recording, then you should continue to share your screen.

Learner Video

Learners' video feeds in the Class Gallery under My View are not recorded by default for privacy reasons. You can enable the recording of the Class Gallery in the Admin Portal. Click here to learn how class recordings can be configured to include or exclude your learners’ video feeds or the Class Gallery [Engageli 3.1 only].

Learner Audio

In Room Mode, which is the Engageli default, learners will be recorded regardless of whether they raise their hands or not. Room Mode captures all audio in the classroom. 
Discussions that happen at the tables when Table Mode is enabled are not recorded.

Tables and Group Activities 

If you are doing group activities, and are visiting tables, the recording will not pause automatically. If you are conducting group activities within the tables, you should pause the recording until you regroup so that there is no blank air time. 

Collaborative Features

If you run a poll during your class, as an ice breaker or to check for understanding, learners watching the recording can also participate in the poll. After you turn on the poll, the poll will be displayed in the recording. If you want asynchronous learners to see the live results, click "Share Results" in the live session. Asynchronous learners will need to answer the poll before seeing the live results.
Any questions posted in the Q&A during the live class will be displayed in the Playback Room. Learners watching the recording can answer the same questions that were posed in the live session. The questions will appear to any learner who attended, whether during the live session or viewing the recording in the Playback Room.
Messages sent in the Chat are not included in the recording and do not persist in the Playback room.
If you distribute a Class or Table Whiteboard to learners during the session, these will be included in the recording. We recommend instructing asynchronous learners to replicate any whiteboard activities done in the live class, as the host can open a whiteboard in the Playback Room.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors can change their settings to include the Class Gallery in recordings. Table whiteboards are also included in the class recording when viewed in an Engageli Playback Room.

Using Tables for Active Learning - Browser
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Engageli tables are strategically designed to increase collaboration between learners. Tables are built so learners will always be in small groups and you do not need to create breakout rooms for group activities. This allows you to create rich learning experiences at the tables while learners also feel simultaneously connected to the larger class and the instructor.

 

Joining Tables

Creating Random Tables Groups 

Moving learners to different Tables

 

Joining Tables

Joining tables allows you to leave the podium and “visit” groups of learners at tables, much like “walking the room” in an in-person class. This is great for any group work or discussions.

Instructions
1. To join a table, click the Tables tab.
2. Hover over the table that you'd like to join and click the JOIN button.

When you join the table, you will see, hear, and interact only with members of the table you joined. This is great when groups have a question on an in-class assignment and you don't want to interrupt the entire class.

3. When you are ready to leave the table, click the Back to podium button. Engageli 3.1 users have several options for returning to the podium.

Note: The audio will automatically switch from Room Mode to Table Mode. When you leave the table, you will have to switch the audio setting back to Room Mode to enable a full-class discussion. Click to learn more about the audio settings.

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors will peek at or observe tables unobtrusively without disturbing the learners. 

 
Creating Random Tables Groups 

This is a great way to encourage learner engagement is to randomly arrange table groups for discussions. 

Instructions

1. Go to the Seating Arrangement drop-down menu in the Tables view. 

2. Select Random Arrangement Table Size.

3. Choose the number of learners you would like at each table. The system will automatically break learners into randomized groups.

You can also reserve any of the first 3 tables for staff or other participants who you don't want to move during the random arrangement. In Engageli 3.0, this is called Skip Tables.

Note: If learners have a reservation, then they will be treated as learners. Make sure to remove any reservations before you do this! (See instructions on reservations here).

You can save the table arrangement you created as a preset that you can use again. Click for information on how to create a table preset during a class.

 

Moving Learners to Different Tables 

Instructions
1. Navigate to the Tables view.
2. Click the profile icon of the learner you wish to move.

3. Choose a new table for the learner from the drop-down menu.

4. Or, you can simply drag and drop the learner to a different table.

25 days ago Updated
Follow

Playback rooms are open classrooms where you can, independently or in a group of up to 10, access class content and engage with the material. Sitting around a virtual table, you can review class recordings and PDFs, participate in polls, ask and answer questions in the Q&A, take notes, and - if in a group - chat, talk, and learn with other classmates.

Engageli 3.1 and Engageli 3.0 will differ in appearance and some functionality.

This article covers:

Accessing Playback Rooms
Playback Player & Class Recordings
Playback Room Features
Playback Room Settings
View Self-Paced Materials [Engageli 3.0]

Complete Modules [Engageli 3.1]

Playback Room Attendance
Invite Other Participants
Accessing Playback Rooms

You can access Playback Rooms directly from the same link that you use for your live Engageli classes.

1. Go to your classroom login page.

2. Select Playback room at the top of the screen.

3. Enter a display name, and then click Enter Playback Room.

Playback Player & Class Recordings

Playback Rooms open to a view of the Playback Player and a list of class recordings. Choose a class recording or video to watch from the list, and then click the play video button in the middle of the playback player.[In Engageli 3.0, use the Select Recording drop-down menu.] Then, you can easily engage with the recording and material. Try doing the following:

Move through the video recording (play, pause, fast forward, back up).
Answer polls as they come up in a class recording.
Respond to class polls and view shared poll responses from the class.

Playback Room Features

In addition to watching class recordings and videos, you can

Take notes and review notes taken in the live class.
Ask and answer questions from class in the Q&A.
Share a screen.
Share a PDF. [Engageli 3.1 only]
Open a whiteboard for brainstorming, sketching, and diagramming.
Complete assigned Modules. [Engageli 3.1 only]
View the transcript of a class recording.
Use reactions and sounds. 
Chat with other users in the Playback room. 
Request help from instructors and TA(s). [Engageli 3.1 only]
View Self-Paced Materials (PDFs).

Note: Playback rooms are designed to optimize collaboration between multiple users. Learners who use the Playback room independently will see a simplified set of features. 

Playback Room Settings

Click Settings to open the Playback room settings:

Audio & Video - add a virtual background, blur your background, or change your audio output devices.
Display Captions - Display closed captions for audio.
Appearance - Change the platform interface language [Engageli 3.1 only] or theme color.

In Engageli 3.0, Click the More Actions (three dots) menu to open the Playback room settings.

View Self-Paced Materials [Engageli 3.0]

1. Click the Actions button at the bottom of the screen.

2. Select Self-Paced Materials.

3. Choose the material you want to view.

4. When you're done, click the red X in the bottom right corner to close the PDF.

Note: At this time, you can’t download the file, but you can take screenshots using the Notes, and then download your notes for later review.

Complete Modules [Engageli 3.1]

1. Select Modules from the bottom toolbar. Any modules will appear in the right pane.

2. If the modules have to be completed in order, they will be grayed out until you complete the module. You will also have to complete the tasks in the order assigned

3. If the modules do not have to be completed in order, you can pick any module and tasks to complete.

4. When you finish all the tasks, the module will be marked complete.

Playback Room Attendance

You can earn attendance credit by watching the class recording in the Playback Room for any class sessions you missed. Ask your instructor about any policies or guidelines regarding Playback Room attendance.

Invite Other Participants

You can invite others to a Playback Room for group project work, a study hall session, or to review a class recording or class content as a group. 

Click By Invitation [link icon] on the bottom right of the screen to get the invite link. In earlier versions of Engageli 3.1, click "Invite & Info".

You can invite participants on the roster or guests who are not on the roster. 

As the host who started the group, you will retain the playback controls. That means you will control which class recording, video, or module is selected for review. You can also mute and ask others to unmute as needed. To pass the playback controls to another participant:

1. Open the Gallery [Tablemates in Engageli 3.0] at the bottom of the screen.

2. Then click the three-dot menu in the person's video feed.

3. Click Make Host.

Using Playback Rooms for Collaboration Spaces and Group Work (v3.1)
24 days ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Playback Rooms are extensions of the Engageli classroom where learners, TAs, and instructors can access and engage with class recordings, modules, and other course material independently or in a group. Playback Rooms are open 24/7 and learners can use them to create online collaborative spaces and complete the assigned tasks together.

 

Accessing the Playback Room

You can access the Playback Room directly from the same link that you use for your live Engageli classes. 

1. Open the classroom URL and select Playback room at the top of the screen.

2. Then, click Start my Playback room. 

Create a Collaboration Space for My Group

The first step for creating a Collaboration Space is to get the invite link for your Playback room. 

1. In your Playback room, click By Invitation in the bottom left corner.

2. Click Copy invite link. 

You can send the link to your peers as well as guests.

 

Instructions for Engageli 3.41: The first step for creating a Collaboration Space is to create a permanent link for the Playback room. 

1. In your Playback Room, click the Invite & Info icon in the bottom left corner.

2. Click Create Permanent Link. 

3. Once the Permanent Link is created, you can copy it to share with your peers as well as guests. 

 Create a Collaboration Space for Anyone to Join

By default, Playback rooms are set to Private, which means that a user needs a guest link from the room in order to join. If set to Open (or Public Mode), your Playback room appears on the login screen for your classmates and peers and they will be able to join without a guest link.

To set the room to Open:

1. Click By invitation in the bottom left corner. 

2. Select Open. 

In Engageli 3.1.41, to set the room to Public Mode, select Private Mode in the bottom left corner and then switch to Public Mode.

This is how public Playback rooms appear to users. 

As the host who started the group, you will retain the playback controls. That means you will control which class recording, video, or assignment is selected for review. To pass the playback controls to another participant:

1. Click the Gallery button at the bottom of the screen.

2. Then click the three-dot menu in the person's video feed.

3. Click Make Host.

Playback Room Features

In addition to watching class recordings and videos, you can

Review and take notes.
Ask and answer questions from class in the Q&A.
Open a whiteboard for brainstorming, sketching, and diagramming.
Complete Modules.
Use the PDF share.
Screen Share.
View the transcript of a class recording.
Chat with other users in the Playback room. 

 

Note: Click here to learn more about using Engageli Playback Rooms.

 

 Need more help? Contact Support.

3 months ago Updated

Q&A, question & answer, threads always persist between live class sessions as well as in the Playback Room, and you will see all posted questions and answers whenever you log into the classroom or the Playback Room.

Instructions

To open the Q&A forum, select the Open Q&A icon in the bottom toolbar. The Q&A will open in a tab on the right side of the screen.

Engageli 3.1 Engageli 3.0

Ask a Question

To ask a question, click on the Q&A tab and type your question. Once posted, the entire class will receive a notification and be able to view and reply to the question. Select Anonymous mode to submit your question anonymously.

Answer a Question

To reply to a question, click on the question to be answered and write your reply in the space below. Select Anonymous mode to submit your answer anonymously.

Note: Any answers to questions submitted by the instructor will appear green, signifying that it is correct. If an instructor or TA marks your answer as correct or approved, it will appear at the top of the thread. Questions with approved/correct answers are always listed at the top of the thread in order from newest to oldest, and below them are listed questions with unmarked answers in order from newest to oldest.

 

Download the Q&A

 

Engagement Tip! Q&A threads always persist between class sessions and you will see all posted questions and answers whenever you log into the classroom. This can be helpful when reviewing material for a quiz or exam. You can download the Q&A thread to save for later review.

Log in to your classroom by following the link provided by your instructor to sign in with your approved credentials. If you use your institution’s LMS, skip steps 4-7. You will be directed straight to the classroom login page.

 

1. Review Engageli’s Technical requirements to ensure your browser, device, and internet are suitable to run Engageli.

2. If you’re using a Learning Management System (LMS) such as Canvas, Blackboard, or Moodle, visit your class page, click on the Engageli link and that will open the class page in a new window. If you're not using an LMS, follow the link provided by your instructor. 

3. Make sure your camera and microphone permissions are turned on. In Google Chrome, you can click the lock icon in your URL address editor at the top of your screen.

4. Click Sign in, and then enter your approved credentials. 

 

5. If your institution uses Gmail, click "Sign in with Google" to be redirected to Google's standard log-in. If your institution uses Outlook or another email provider, type in your email address in the space, and then click "SUBMIT."

6. If you have typed in your email address, you will receive an email with a one-time password. Save this code.

 

 

7. You can then enter the code and click "SUBMIT."

8. Once you get to the classroom login screen, check your audio and video sources and enter a name to be displayed in the classroom. You can use parentheses to include a title, pronouns, or other information.

How to Upload Roster Seating Plans
8 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

This article includes:

Access table presets in the Engageli Admin Portal

Prepare your classroom for table assignments

Prepare your roster and table names

Upload class roster

Apply Roster Seating in the classroom

When Roster Seating is used in a classroom, learners are assigned to specific tables initially set up on the class roster in the Admin Portal. These serve as default table assignments. Tables can be pre-assigned to learners so that they will automatically be placed at the table you decide. If no table is pre-assigned, the learner will be placed automatically at the next available seat.

Access table presets in the Engageli Admin Portal

1. Go to the Admin Portal.

2. Click Class Management on the left to expand the menu. 

3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class. 

4. Click Tables & Preset.

Prepare your classroom for table assignments

After you click Tables & Presets, you will see tabs for Tables and Presets. An Engageli classroom opens with 5 tables, each with 10 seats, by default. As the tables fill with learners, more tables are added automatically. However, you can manually add tables 5 at a time but be careful not to add too many, as currently they cannot be removed.

To add tables, click the plus sign icon in the top right corner of the Tables tab.

To add custom table names, click the table name to edit and make changes.

 

Prepare your roster and table names

You can find a template to import your roster and table names and assignments here. To find this template in the Admin Portal:

1. Click Class Management on the left to expand the menu. 

2. Select your class or use the search field to find your class. 

3. Click Details.

4. Select the Roster tab.

5. Click the Update class with a CSV icon.

6. Click the link for samples and templates.

 

Follow the instructions to create a copy of the template in Google Sheets (or download to Excel).

1. Paste or type in the email addresses and names of your learners (columns A and B).

2. Role should be set to “Learner” (column C).

3. Ensure the Table group name matches the name in the portal (column E).

4. Select File -> Download -> Comma Separated Values (.csv). The sheet will be exported as a CSV file into your Downloads folder. You may want to rename the file if you are doing multiple classrooms.

 
Upload class roster

 

After you create your roster file, go to the Roster tab in the Admin Portal (Details > Roster).

1. Click the Update Class with a CSV icon.

2. Click BROWSE to select the CSV file from your computer.

3. Click UPDATE.

4. This will update your class, populate the roster and assign table seating.

 

Apply Roster Seating in the classroom

When you enter your classroom to teach, go to the TABLES view.

From the Seating Arrangement drop-down menu, select Roster Seating.

 

Any learners present who have a table assigned will be placed automatically at the right table immediately, and as more learners join they will too.

Any learners who are not assigned to a table, or who are not on the roster, will be assigned a seat at the next available table.

There are three ways to ask a question in class: raising your hand, sending a chat message, and using the Q&A

 

Raising Hand

To address the entire class and the instructor, click the raise hand icon. Your video will move to the podium at the top of the screen and everyone will hear you. 

Reminder: In Room mode everyone can hear you without raising your hand. In Table mode, only your tablemates can hear you. Raise your hand to address the entire class.

Chat Message

Easily create and launch for your Engageli classroom in a browser window. 

Instructions for Engageli 3.1.

Create and Launch a Browser-Based Classroom

1. Sign in. If you are using Engageli for the first time, you’ll also need to register your account. 

2. After logging in, you can either create a new classroom or choose an already existing classroom. If you are ready to start an already-existing class, find the classroom and click Start. 

3. Click Create new classroom.

4. Enter a name for the class.

5. Click Create.

6. Next, you can add dates and times to schedule your time or you can skip this step.

You can add learners manually, or by importing a CSV file. You can also skip this step.

7. Lastly, you can copy the link for the class to send in an invite to your learner.

8. Click Done.

If you skipped steps 6 and 7, you can click Edit Class to schedule your classes or add learners.

If you need to do any pre-class setup (upload videos, set up documents, create preset table arrangements, etc.), click the Admin Portal button. This will take you to the Admin Portal where you can configure your classroom, adjust settings, and view class data. 

Open the Classroom

Click the Start live class button, and the classroom log-in page should open automatically.

1. Select the appropriate devices to use for the Camera, Microphone, and Speaker.

2. Click Background Settings to blur or choose a different background for your video feed.

3. Enter a name to be displayed to the class.

4. Click Join Classroom.

Note: If you need to access the Admin Portal to do prep work or check your roster, click Manage Class above the Enter Classroom button.

Instructions for Engageli 3.0

Create and Launch a Browser-Based Classroom

1. Sign in. If you are using Engageli for the first time, you’ll also need to register your account.

3. If you need to do any pre-class setup (upload videos, set up documents, create preset table arrangements, etc.), click the three dots menu, and then Portal Access. This will take you to the Admin Portal where you can configure your classroom, adjust settings, and view class data. 

4.  Click the Join button, and the classroom log-in page should open automatically.

5. Select the appropriate devices to use for the Camera, Microphone, and Speaker.

6. Click Background Settings to blur or choose a different background for your video feed.

7. Enter a name to be displayed to the class.

8. Choose a Role (Instructor).

9. Click Enter Classroom.

Note: If you need to access the Admin Portal to do prep work or check your roster, click Manage Class above the Enter Classroom button.

Logging into Your Classroom

For users who have a class/institution portal or Learning Management System (LMS) such as Canvas, Blackboard, or Moodle:

Log into your LMS on Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.

Find your class.

Click the link to open the Engageli classroom.

Note: Saving the classroom link will NOT allow you to access the class at a future date, you must authenticate through your LMS to log in.

For users who do not have an LMS, access the class with the link provided by your instructor.

 

Setting up Permissions

The first time you enter a classroom, you will be required to allow permissions at a browser level and sometimes at a system level.

Browser Permissions

Click REQUEST PERMISSIONS. If you don’t see the REQUEST PERMISSIONS button, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.

You will see a pop-up on the left asking you to grant Camera access to Engageli. Click Allow.

Next, you will see a pop-up on the left asking you to grant Microphone access to Engageli. Click Allow.

If you accidentally clicked “Block” in either of the pop-ups, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.

Make sure that the settings for Camera and Microphone are both set to On/Allow.

System Permissions

If your system has not enabled browser access to your camera and microphone, you will see a message directing you to update your system settings.

Click the Search bar at the bottom of the screen.

Search for Privacy.

In the Settings, click Camera (under App permissions on the left).

Switch Camera access On.

Scroll down and make sure “Let desktop apps access your camera” is also switched On.

Click Microphone (under App permissions on the left).

Switch Microphone access On.

Scroll down and make sure “Let desktop apps access your microphone” is also switched On.

Close the settings and go back to the Engageli login screen.

Refresh the page.

How to Use the Notes
2 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Taking notes can make it difficult to stay engaged and follow along with a class presentation or discussion. With Engageli’s Notes feature, you can:

Take screenshots of what is being shared via screen share, PDF file live share, or whiteboards
Annotate the screenshots to reduce the cognitive load with note taking.*

Note: No one can take screenshots of the Class Gallery or Table view, to protect learner privacy.

Engageli learners always have access to the Notes feature in the live session and in the Playback Room. Browser-based instructors can also take notes. The Notes are private, downloadable for future reference, and persist between live sessions and the Playback Room, so you will see them each time you log into an Engageli classroom or Playback Room to watch recordings.

Instructions

1. To take notes, select the Notes icon at the bottom of the screen.

2. Type in the Start typing field, and then either hit return or enter on your keyboard or click the send icon to add your note.

3. Click the camera icon to take a screenshot of a shared screen or presentation. 

4. Hit Click to annotate to highlight, add text, or other notations to the screenshot.

5. Click Save & Close to save your annotations.

6. Click the download icon to export your notes as a .docx file. 

Notes:

A timestamp is displayed next to each note taken so you can easily find your place when later watching class recordings.  

You can delete entries by clicking the trash bin icon to the right of the notes.

 

*Flanigan, A. E., & Titsworth, S. (2020). The impact of digital distraction on lecture note taking and student learning. Instructional Science, 48(5), 495-524.

How to Participate in Polls
2 months ago Updated

This article details how learners can easily participate in interactive polls and quizzes during class.

There are three types of Engageli polls:

Single choice: There are multiple options to choose from, but only one answer can be selected.

Multiple choice: There are multiple options to choose from, and you can select as many answers as you want.

Text input: You can type a short response (up to 40 characters) and when shared, the answers will form a word cloud on the screen.

How to Participate in Polls

You can enter your response directly on the screen to answer any of the poll questions.

You do not have to use the chat or speak your answers aloud. 
Your answer is recorded as soon as you respond. 
While the poll is open, you can select different responses to change your answer(s). All answers are recorded. If your instructor locks the poll, you will not be able to change your answer.
If the results are shared, your response will be anonymous to the class, but your instructor will be able to see your last response on your video feed in the class gallery.
Single Choice

Use your mouse or keypad to choose a response. The color of your answer choice will fill in when your response is submitted. 

Multiple Choice

Use your mouse or keypad to choose your responses. The color of your answer choices will fill in when your response is submitted. 



Text Input/Word Cloud

Type your answer in the text field. Click the check mark on the right to submit your answer. 

How to See Results 

As a learner, you can only see the results of the poll or quiz if the instructor shares the results. The results will be displayed on the right, and while the poll is open you will see the responses change in real-time.

Engageli now has two main audio modes, Room Mode and Table Mode.

Room Mode:

This is the default when you enter your Engageli classroom. This means that as the instructor you will hear the audio feeds from all learners, and they will hear each other, regardless of where they are seated.

When to use: the beginning of class, or entire classroom discussions

 

Table Mode:

When you enable Table Mode, learners will hear only their table mates and you will only hear learners who raise their hands. 

When to use: small group discussions, projects, and other table activities

 

You can easily toggle between the two modes from the bottom right corner of the screen.

  

If you or a co-instructor join a table, Engageli automatically switches to Table Mode. When at a table, you will only hear the learners at that table (and any learners at other tables that raise their hands).  While an instructor is at a table, no instructor will be able to change the mode to Room Mode. 

For learners, the tablemates panel will automatically close when switching the audio mode to Room mode from the Table audio mode so learners direct their attention back to the class.

If you would like to hear all the learners concurrently while at the podium in Table Mode, click on the three dots and choose ‘Hear tables while on podium in table mode’. 

 

 

You can hover over the Table Mode and Room Mode buttons to see who you can hear and who can hear you. 





Note: All audio will be recorded in Room Mode and only those on podium (learners with hands raised or instructor(s)) will be recorded in Table Mode.

How to Designate a Teaching Assistant (TA) for your Engageli Class
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

As an instructor, you can assign TAs to help support your class. Follow the guidelines below to learn how to designate a TA for your class.

 

Instructions

If you use Engageli with an LMS integration (Canvas, Blackboard, Moodle, etc.), TAs should be designated in the course settings within the LMS. There is nothing else you need to do in the Engageli portal.

If you do not use Engageli with an LMS integration and would like to designate a TA for your class:

1. Go to the Admin Portal.
2. Click Class Management on the left to expand the menu.
3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class.
4. Click Details.
5. Click the Roster tab.
6. Select the person you want to designate as a TA. If they are not on the roster, add them.
7. Click the pencil icon to update the person’s role.
8. Select ‘TA’ and then click Update.

TA Role

TAs sit at tables with the learners and they have the following capabilities within the Engageli classroom:

TAs can send and receive messages to ‘Staff’ in the chat to backchannel with fellow TAs and instructors.

TAs can see poll results before they’re shared with the rest of the class.

TAs can approve answers in the Q&A. Answers marked as ‘Approved’ appear at the top of the list.
TAs can submit answers in the Q&A that are automatically ‘Approved’ and appear at the top of the list. 
TAs can delete questions and responses posted in the Q&A.
TAs do not get moved during randomly assigned tables. 
TAs can move between tables, even during preset table arrangements. 
TAs can visit full tables.
TAs can see the engagement markers on learner video feeds in the class gallery.
TAs can approve a learner’s screen share request.
TAs can mute a learner.
TAs can ask a learner to unmute.
TAs can mute all learners.
TAs can ask all learners to unmute.
TAs can turn off a learner’s camera.
TAs can ask a learner to turn on their camera.
TAs can move learners to different tables.
TAs can change the user role for others.
TAs can block a learner from class.
TAs can send chat messages that appear as announcements at the top of learners' screens.
TAs are distinguished by a blue ‘TA’ badge in the bottom right corner of their video feed in the Class Gallery and at their tables and also a blue circle around their icon in the Tables view.

  

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors can easily make any learner a TA during the live session.

How to Set Up Your Class Roster and Assigned Seating
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Why Upload Roster?  Learners entering an Engageli classroom through your institution’s Learning Management System do not need to be pre-added to the Engageli roster for classroom access. However, if we are not integrated with your institution’s LMS or you want to use specific seating assignments during class, you will need to have a list of learners in the system. 

 

Setting Up Class Roster

1. Navigate to the Engageli portal and find your classroom. 

2. Under Details > Roster, upload a list of all learners, TAs, and instructors (including you!) in your class.  You can add users individually (plus sign) or through bulk upload (paper with the plus sign - See more detailed instructions below). 

3. If you are planning to pre-assign seating, you can also include the table number/name you want each student to sit at. See more detailed instructions below.

 

Adding Class Participants in Bulk 

1. Bulk add using the .csv template.

2. Click ‘Samples and templates here’, which will open the template as a Google Document. 

3. Choose File > Make a copy. You can name this copy whatever you like. 

4. Fill out the CSV file with a list of learners, instructors, and TAs who should be allowed to join this classroom. 

 

5. When finished, go to File > Download > Comma-separated values (.csv, current sheet) to save to your computer. 

6. Upload this roster from your computer into the Roster tab of the Portal. 

 

Assigning Seats 

Open seating is the default, but sometimes it can be helpful to assign seats for certain times during the session. You can save multiple presets to use during different points in the class (e.g. start of class, activity time, quiz time). This allows you to easily ‘move’ learners into different pre-assigned groups, without having to use time during class creating them. You can assign learners to randomly-combined groups of select sizes (1-10 learners) at any time (see detailed instructions here).

 

1. Under Tables & Presets > Tables, start by customizing the names for each table (e.g., for project groups) if desired. 

 

2. Under Tables & Presets > Presets, Click ‘Samples and templates here’, which will open the template as a Google Document. 

3. Choose File > Make a copy. You can name this copy whatever you like. 

4. Add each learner’s email and the table you want them added to upon joining. 

 

In this example, we have placed three students in each project group. Upon login, they will automatically be placed at Project Group 1 Table and Project Group 2 Table. Please note: The tables in your .cvs file must match the names of tables you created in step two. If you did not rename tables, use “Table 1”, “Table 2”, as in the default labels.

 

5. When finished, go to File > Download > Comma-separated values (.csv, current sheet) to save to your computer. 

6. Click ‘Upload Preset’

7. Name the preset and add a description if helpful (ex: Group Activity - Use this preset when you start group activity). 

8. Upload the preset by clicking Files.

 

9. Once presets have been uploaded, you will see a learner’s assigned location for each preset saved next to their name in the roster tab. 

 

Using Presets in the Classroom 

1. Once in your Classroom, at the relevant time, go to Tables > Seating Arrangement > Apply Preset to apply the desired preset. 

2. Throughout the class, you can choose different presets and Engageli will move learners automatically. You can learn more about table settings in class here and here. 

Click to learn how to add a tag to your presentation to easily activate a table preset or put learners into a random table arrangement.

On the instructor application, there are a few settings you can use if you have low internet bandwidth or are using an older computer. These settings can help with performance.

 

On the application login page, click ‘Advanced Settings’.

1. ‘Enable low-performance mode’ enhances the quality of published and subscribed videos when using an old computer. This mode will save bandwidth by automatically turning off learner video feeds in the gallery, however, video feeds in tables will still be visible and you will be able to see when learners raise their hands. 



2. ‘Enable slow network mode’ enhances the quality of published and subscribed videos. The slow network will impact what is being sent out to your class and shown on the learners’ screen (i.e. your video feed could seem delayed or your screen share will not be completely clear). 



3. ‘Enable invisible mode for screen share’ should be used when you are planning to share your whole screen and do not want learners to see the Engageli application windows. This is particularly useful if you want to share multiple applications in quick succession without stopping and restarting the screen share.

Please note the following:

-this setting will require more CPU / bandwidth from your computer to work well

-this setting will impede your ability to take a screenshot of your screen



When enabled, you will see the following on your screen: 

In contrast, your class will see the following:


4. ‘Enable high bandwidth mode’ affects the quality of desktop screen share, making it better, both in terms of bitrate and resolution. This makes your screen share more clear and there will be less of a delay in slide changes.

How to Lock/Unlock A Classroom
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

When a classroom is Locked, it is not in session and is closed. Learners cannot enter a locked classroom without having an instructor logged in.

When a classroom is Unlocked, learners can enter without having an instructor logged in.

Engageli classrooms are unlocked by default. 

To unlock a classroom:

Go to the Admin Portal.

Click Classes (Class Management in v3.0) on the left to expand the menu.

Select your class or use the search field to find your class.

Click the class name.

Click Unlock Class in the upper right corner. 

When an Engageli class is not in session, it is considered “locked” or closed. This means that you can edit your roster, create table presets, name tables, add video clips to be shared, and upload documents to be distributed during class.

When an Engageli class is in session, it is considered “unlocked.” You can still access the class settings through the Portal but you will have some limitations as to what changes you can make.

 

 

You need to “lock” or end the class in order to:

Delete or edit users from the roster. 
Change a learner’s gallery position or group table.
Change table names.
Add tables.
Remove tables
Add or remove table presets
Add or edit materials
Edit sub-rooms
Enable guest links.

You can choose to lock the class in order to make any of the above changes, but doing so will end the class and remove the learners from the classroom. 

Note: When the class is “unlocked” or in session, you can still add people to the roster, but you can’t delete them or edit their roles (instructor, TA, student).

Adding a quiz or a poll to your presentation can help you learn more about your learners and check their understanding of the material.

 

1. Choose if this is a single choice, multiple choice, or text input question.

Single choice: There are multiple options to choose from, but only one answer can be selected.

Multiple choice: There are multiple options to choose from, and you can select as many answers as you want.

Text input: You can type a short response (up to 40 characters) and the answers will form a word cloud on the screen.

2. Set up your slide or document with your question, leaving room for the tags (QR codes).

 

3. Click and drag the tags from step 1 into your slide or document depending on the response type you want for your poll.

Note: The same tag must be used for each answer choice and must be at least 75x75 px in size.

 

You can create customized tags for polls and quizzes in the Action Tags Lab.

1. Go to the Action Tags Lab in the Admin portal.
2. Select Polls & Quizzes.
3. Select a poll type from the 3 options:

Single choice
Multiple choice
Text input (word cloud)

4. Name your tag with the label or response option that learners will see in the poll.
5. Copy the poll tag to paste into a document or slide.
6. Or, download a copy of the poll tag.

How to Create a Poll or Quiz
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Adding a quiz or a poll to your presentation can help you learn more about your learners and check their understanding of the material.

 

1. Choose if this is a single choice, multiple choice, or text input question.

Single choice: There are multiple options to choose from, but only one answer can be selected.

Multiple choice: There are multiple options to choose from, and you can select as many answers as you want.

Text input: You can type a short response (up to 40 characters) and the answers will form a word cloud on the screen.

2. Set up your slide or document with your question, leaving room for the tags (QR codes).

 

3. Click and drag the tags from step 1 into your slide or document depending on the response type you want for your poll.

Note: The same tag must be used for each answer choice and must be at least 75x75 px in size.

 

You can create customized tags for polls and quizzes in the Action Tags Lab.

1. Go to the Action Tags Lab in the Admin portal.
2. Select Polls & Quizzes.
3. Select a poll type from the 3 options:

Single choice
Multiple choice
Text input (word cloud)

4. Name your tag with the label or response option that learners will see in the poll.
5. Copy the poll tag to paste into a document or slide.
6. Or, download a copy of the poll tag.

Click here to learn how to use your created polls.

By default, the Engageli classroom opens to a view of the class gallery for both instructors and learners. Follow the instructions below to direct the class to a different view.

Instructor’s video: Direct view to your video (your video feed will become the center of the screen).


	

Miro Whiteboard: Direct view to the Miro whiteboard.


	

Panel: Direct view to participants who have been added to a panel.

html:
What’s the difference between the ‘Link to class’ and ‘Link to file’ options in the Recordings section of the portal?
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone
As an instructor, you can access a recording of your Engageli class in the Playback room or download the file directly. Follow the steps below to access links to your class recordings.

1. Login to the Engageli portal.

2. Find your class under Classes (Class Management in v3.0), then click Recordings and you will see a list of all recordings.

 

 

3. Select Link to class to be directed to a link of the class recording in the Engageli Playback room. The recording in the Playback room will display any polls run during the class, and learners viewing the recording asynchronously will be able to participate in the polls. The notes that learners take during class and answers to Q&A questions persist in the Playback room to provide an optimal viewing experience for learners. You can access all recordings directly from the same Engageli classroom link that you use for your live classes. 

Attendance is recorded and can be viewed in the Admin Portal for learners who watch the class recording in an Engageli Playback room. 

 

4. Select Link to file to access an MP4 file of the recording. Unlike the recording in the Engageli Playback room, the MP4 file does not display poll results. You can convert the file as needed and upload it to a video hosting platform such as YouTube, Vimeo, or Kaltura. If you want to copy the link, click the file link directly and allow it to open in a new browser window. If you right-click and copy the link, learners will have to authenticate and view the recording in an Engageli Playback room.

Attendance is not recorded for learners who watch a shared MP4 file of the class recording.

 

Note: Before sharing recordings with the class, please check the FERPA guidelines at your institution. Playback rooms can be accessed through the same class link that authenticates learners to enter the live session. The mp4 recordings can be downloaded by anyone if they have the link and can be shared externally.

Table reservations ensure that a learner can keep their spot at a table should they lose their internet connection and get logged out of the classroom. When the learner re-joins the classroom, they will automatically be placed at the same table as before. Because of having an assigned seat at the table, a table of seven present learners and three reserved is considered full.

You may want to remove reservations to free up space at certain tables or create random table groups without including reservations in the count.

In the Tables view, you can see all reservations represented by a dotted line around a learner’s profile.

Instructions

1. Select the Tables tab at the top of the screen.

2. Click the Seating arrangement drop-down menu.

3. Click Remove All Reservations.

Note: Individual reservations will be automatically removed after 5 minutes of inactivity.

How to Skip Tables During Random Table Arrangements
2 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

You can easily skip or set aside tables during random table arrangements.

 

Instructions

Click the Tables tab.
Click the Seating arrangement drop-down menu.
Select Create Random Seating Arrangement.
Use the slider to choose the number of learners per table.  (TAs won’t be moved to a different table.)
If you want to skip or set aside certain tables, use the slider to select the tables.
Click Confirm.

Note: The number of tables to skip corresponds to the first nine tables in the classroom, left to right. If you choose to skip 1 table, no learners will be assigned to Table 1. If you choose to skip 2 tables, no learners will be assigned to Table 1 or Table 2. TAs are not affected by random table arrangements, and if they are placed at a skipped table, they will remain at the table, but no other learners will be assigned to that table.

When to Use:

When you have support individuals, such as teaching assistants, administrative staff, or mentors who will not take part in table activities
When you have a dedicated support table, with TAs who you’d like to remain seated at that table
When you have someone observing your teaching and you’d like them to go to a set table so you can join and discuss their observations while learners work at their tables
When you have guests who you would like to place at one table so you can join the table and discuss content while learners work in groups
When you have guests who you would like to remain at one table so you can easily add them to a panel or ask them to join the podium

1. When a learner shares their screen, their video feed will immediately appear at the top of the screen on the podium.
2. Click the three dots in the middle of the learner’s video feed.


3. Select Approve screen share from the menu to immediately approve the screen share request.

4. You can reject the request by selecting Lower hand, or simply not selecting Approve screen share.

 

Note: You do not need to approve when learners share their screens with their tablemates.




 

Approve screen share request in Moderated Mode
In Moderated Mode, you can approve these requests by first approving the learner’s hand raise, and then approving the screen share.

Instructions

1. First, approve the learner’s hand raise by clicking the Queue drop-down list.

2. Then, select the green check to approve the hand raise.
3. Once, the learner’s video feed appears on the podium, select Approve screen share from the menu to approve the request.

Instructors can change their classroom settings to allow learners to share their screens without needing approval. Click here to learn more.

Step 3: Allow permissions
2 months ago Updated

Mac & Chrome Windows & Chrome

 

Setting up Permissions

The first time you enter a classroom, you will be required to allow permissions at a browser level and sometimes at a system level.

Browser Permissions
Click "Allow". If you don’t see the "Allow" button, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.

You will see a pop-up on the left asking you to grant Camera access to Engageli. Click Allow.
Next, you will see a pop up on the left asking you to grant Microphone access to Engageli. Click Allow.
If you accidentally clicked “Block” in either of the pop-ups, click the lock icon on the left side of the URL address bar.
Make sure that the settings for Camera and Microphone are both set to On/Allow.

2. System Permissions

If your system has not enabled browser access to your camera and microphone, you will be prompted to open System Preferences or (a drop-down notification will appear on the right of your URL bar).

Click System Settings () or the Apple logo in the top left corner of the screen to access the System Settings.
Select Security & Privacy.
Click the lock icon at the bottom of the window to make changes.
Enter your password to unlock.
Select Camera from the menu on the left.
Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).
Select “Later” when prompted to quit & reopen Microsoft Edge.
Select Microphone from the menu on the left.
Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).
Select “Later” when prompted to quit & reopen Microsoft Edge.
Select Screen Recordings from the menu on the left.
Check the box next to Google Chrome/Microsoft Edge (if unchecked).
Select Quit & Reopen to apply changes.
Go back to your Engageli classroom.

Note: If you don’t see the Quit & Reopen pop-up, you’ll need to manually quit the browser (Cmd +Q), and then reopen it.

 

You will now be in the lobby area of your classroom, where you can edit your camera and microphone, add a background and test your system, before joining the classroom.

Open seating is the default, but sometimes it can be helpful to assign seats for certain times or specific activities during the session.

You can save multiple presets to use at different times during the class (e.g. start of class, activity time, quiz time, etc.). This allows you to easily ‘move’ learners into different pre-assigned groups without having to use class time to create them.

Instructions

Go to the Admin Portal.
Click Class Management from the menu on the Left.
Select your class from the list of Active Classes or use the search field to find your class.

Click the class name.
Select Tables & Presets from the menu on the left.
Click the Tables tab to add custom names for each table, if desired.                     
Click the Presets tab to create or upload a preset. 
Click View a sample/CSV template here to open the template as a Google Document.  
Choose File > Make a copy. You can name this copy whatever you like.
Add each learner’s email and the table you want them added to upon joining. In this example, we have placed three students in each project group. Upon login, they will automatically be placed at Project Group 1 table and Project Group 2 table. Please note: The tables in your .cvs file must match the names of the tables you created in step 6. If you did not rename tables, use the default table names: Table 1, Table 2, Table 3, etc. 
When finished, go to File > Download > Comma-separated values (.csv, current sheet) to save the file to your computer.
Click Upload Preset.
Name the preset and add a description if helpful (ex: Group Activity - Use this preset when you start group activity).                                                                
Upload the preset by clicking Files, and then Add.                         
Once presets have been uploaded, you will see a learner’s assigned location for each preset saved next to their name in the Roster tab in the portal. 

Note: Without presets, you can still assign learners to randomly-combined groups of select sizes (1-10 learners) at any time. Click here for instructions.

 Engageli 3.1 Feature 

This feature is available in Engageli 3.1. Click to learn more about Engageli 3.1. Click to read the Engageli 3.1 release notes.

There may be some learners or participants who are unable to join the session via their computer or mobile apps due to connectivity issues or who simply want to participate in sessions or meetings by audio only. The dial-in option allows users to join the live session as a learner by calling the session-specific number which can be enabled in the Admin Portal. If learners dial into the session, they will be listed in the Class Gallery as anonymous “Phone Guests” and they will not appear in the attendance analytics for the class session. They will be placed at a table like all other learners and will get a notification of any audio changes, so they will know if they are speaking to the whole class or just their tablemates. If they would like to unmute to speak, they can press 2, and repeat to mute. If they would like to come to the Podium to be heard by the whole class, they can press 1, and repeat to lower their hand. 

Best Practices

If you have a camera-on policy for your classroom, consider making an allowance for dial-in users, as they will not have the ability to be camera-on.

Ensure you communicate group engagement guidelines, such as when and how you'd like learners to unmute and speak, raise their hands, or when they need to stay muted during presentations of content, direct instruction, videos, etc.

Dial-in users will not have a displayed name. To ensure that you provide attendance credit or know who is in attendance, we recommend asking all users to introduce themselves by unmuting and sharing their names and pronouns. You or your staff can document your dial-in users' names in the Notes for future reference.

Set aside 1-2 minutes during table-based activities for learners to introduce themselves at their tables. Assign one group manager or representative to take notes or adds ideas from dial-in users to Whiteboards or shared Google/Microsoft 365 materials, so their contributions are included.

Record your sessions so that dial-in users can return to the recording in the Playback Room and engage in interactive components such as Polls, Whiteboards, Google/Microsoft 365 materials.

How to Set Up Your Class Roster and Assigned Seating
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

Why Upload Roster?  Learners entering an Engageli classroom through your institution’s Learning Management System do not need to be pre-added to the Engageli roster for classroom access. However, if we are not integrated with your institution’s LMS or you want to use specific seating assignments during class, you will need to have a list of learners in the system. 

 

Setting Up Class Roster

1. Navigate to the Engageli portal and find your classroom. 

2. Under Details > Roster, upload a list of all learners, TAs, and instructors (including you!) in your class.  You can add users individually (plus sign) or through bulk upload (paper with the plus sign - See more detailed instructions below). 

3. If you are planning to pre-assign seating, you can also include the table number/name you want each student to sit at. See more detailed instructions below.

 

Adding Class Participants in Bulk 

1. Bulk add using the .csv template.

2. Click ‘Samples and templates here’, which will open the template as a Google Document. 

3. Choose File > Make a copy. You can name this copy whatever you like. 

4. Fill out the CSV file with a list of learners, instructors, and TAs who should be allowed to join this classroom. 

 

5. When finished, go to File > Download > Comma-separated values (.csv, current sheet) to save to your computer. 

6. Upload this roster from your computer into the Roster tab of the Portal. 

 

Assigning Seats 

Open seating is the default, but sometimes it can be helpful to assign seats for certain times during the session. You can save multiple presets to use during different points in the class (e.g. start of class, activity time, quiz time). This allows you to easily ‘move’ learners into different pre-assigned groups, without having to use time during class creating them. You can assign learners to randomly-combined groups of select sizes (1-10 learners) at any time (see detailed instructions here).

 

1. Under Tables & Presets > Tables, start by customizing the names for each table (e.g., for project groups) if desired. 

 

2. Under Tables & Presets > Presets, Click ‘Samples and templates here’, which will open the template as a Google Document. 

3. Choose File > Make a copy. You can name this copy whatever you like. 

4. Add each learner’s email and the table you want them added to upon joining. 

 

In this example, we have placed three students in each project group. Upon login, they will automatically be placed at Project Group 1 Table and Project Group 2 Table. Please note: The tables in your .cvs file must match the names of tables you created in step two. If you did not rename tables, use “Table 1”, “Table 2”, as in the default labels.

 

5. When finished, go to File > Download > Comma-separated values (.csv, current sheet) to save to your computer. 

6. Click ‘Upload Preset’

7. Name the preset and add a description if helpful (ex: Group Activity - Use this preset when you start group activity). 

8. Upload the preset by clicking Files.

 

9. Once presets have been uploaded, you will see a learner’s assigned location for each preset saved next to their name in the roster tab. 

 

Using Presets in the Classroom 

1. Once in your Classroom, at the relevant time, go to Tables > Seating Arrangement > Apply Preset to apply the desired preset. 

2. Throughout the class, you can choose different presets and Engageli will move learners automatically. You can learn more about table settings in class here and here. 

Click to learn how to add a tag to your presentation to easily activate a table preset or put learners into a random table arrangement.

How to Designate a Teaching Assistant (TA) for your Engageli Class
3 months ago Updated
Follow
Not yet followed by anyone

As an instructor, you can assign TAs to help support your class. Follow the guidelines below to learn how to designate a TA for your class.

 

Instructions

If you use Engageli with an LMS integration (Canvas, Blackboard, Moodle, etc.), TAs should be designated in the course settings within the LMS. There is nothing else you need to do in the Engageli portal.

If you do not use Engageli with an LMS integration and would like to designate a TA for your class:

1. Go to the Admin Portal.
2. Click Class Management on the left to expand the menu.
3. Select your class or use the search field to find your class.
4. Click Details.
5. Click the Roster tab.
6. Select the person you want to designate as a TA. If they are not on the roster, add them.
7. Click the pencil icon to update the person’s role.
8. Select ‘TA’ and then click Update.

TA Role

TAs sit at tables with the learners and they have the following capabilities within the Engageli classroom:

TAs can send and receive messages to ‘Staff’ in the chat to backchannel with fellow TAs and instructors.

TAs can see poll results before they’re shared with the rest of the class.

TAs can approve answers in the Q&A. Answers marked as ‘Approved’ appear at the top of the list.
TAs can submit answers in the Q&A that are automatically ‘Approved’ and appear at the top of the list. 
TAs can delete questions and responses posted in the Q&A.
TAs do not get moved during randomly assigned tables. 
TAs can move between tables, even during preset table arrangements. 
TAs can visit full tables.
TAs can see the engagement markers on learner video feeds in the class gallery.
TAs can approve a learner’s screen share request.
TAs can mute a learner.
TAs can ask a learner to unmute.
TAs can mute all learners.
TAs can ask all learners to unmute.
TAs can turn off a learner’s camera.
TAs can ask a learner to turn on their camera.
TAs can move learners to different tables.
TAs can change the user role for others.
TAs can block a learner from class.
TAs can send chat messages that appear as announcements at the top of learners' screens.
TAs are distinguished by a blue ‘TA’ badge in the bottom right corner of their video feed in the Class Gallery and at their tables and also a blue circle around their icon in the Tables view.

  

New in Engageli 3.1!

In Engageli 3.1, instructors can easily make any learner a TA during the live session.
